Safety-critical systems built with COTS; This paper presents the Vital Framework (V-Frame), which uses formal methods and information redundancy to build fail-safe, safety-critical systems from commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) hardware and software.
Inventory management system for determining suggested part stocking levels for a vehicle dealer
A Safety Assessment Methodology for Complex Safety-Critical Hardware/Software Systems

An Analysis of the ATCS Generator Polynomial; This paper presents the first known analysis of the Advanced Train Control Systems (ATCS) generator polynomial, providing evidence of its minimum Hamming distance to support its use in vital railway communication systems.

An Integrative Approach to Embedded Systems Courseware Submission Type: Work in Progress; This work-in-progress paper discusses an integrative approach to embedded systems courseware, including a new bridge course that links introductory embedded computing with advanced RTOS concepts.

Assessment of Comprehension Retention in a Modern Electrical and Computer Engineering Curriculum; This paper discusses a major curriculum update in Electrical and Computer Engineering that moves from isolated courses to an integrated spectrum of topics to improve student comprehension and retention.

Development of Concept-Linking Inventories for a Breadth-First Approach in Electrical Engineering Fundamentals Pedagogy; This paper presents the development of concept-linking inventories designed to assess student understanding of the relationships between electrical circuits, electronics, and signals & systems in a revised, integrated curriculum.
Method of analyzing the safety of a device employing on target hardware description language based fault injection

A steep-slope transistor based on abrupt electronic phase transition; This paper demonstrates a hybrid-phase-transition field-effect transistor using vanadium dioxide (VO2) that exhibits steep, reversible, gate-controlled switching at room temperature by harnessing the material's abrupt insulator-to-metal transition.

Synchronized charge oscillations in correlated electron systems; This article demonstrates that synchronized charge oscillations can be achieved in coupled vanadium dioxide (VO2) relaxation oscillators by inducing a non-hysteretic, reversible metal-insulator phase transition via a negative feedback mechanism.

Vertex coloring of graphs via phase dynamics of coupled oscillatory networks; This paper demonstrates a dynamical system of coupled vanadium dioxide (VO2) relaxation oscillators that exploits the material's insulator-metal transition to efficiently solve the vertex coloring of graphs, a computationally hard problem.

Joule Heating-Induced Metal–Insulator Transition in Epitaxial VO2/TiO2 Devices; This study shows that the voltage-induced metal-insulator transition in epitaxial VO2 devices is caused by the Joule heating effect, with electrothermal simulations showing good agreement with measured DC and transient characteristics.

Transport properties of ultra-thin VO2 films on (001) TiO2 grown by reactive molecular-beam epitaxy; This paper reports the growth of ultra-thin (1.5 nm) VO2 films with abrupt metal-insulator transitions, identifying control of island coalescence and minimization of cation interdiffusion as crucial for achieving this behavior.

FIMA: A Scalable Ferroelectric Compute-in-Memory Annealer for Accelerating Boolean Satisfiability; This work proposes FIMA, a scalable ferroelectric compute-in-memory annealer based on a FeFET array that accelerates the solving of Boolean Satisfiability (SAT) problems and is compatible with modular memory architectures.

Spin Freezing in Oscillator Ising Machines: When Second Harmonic Injection Impedes Computation; This work demonstrates that second harmonic injection (SHI) in Oscillator Ising Machines can induce "spin freezing," a phenomenon that impedes computation by preventing oscillators from reaching lower-energy states.

Bridging the Analog and the Probabilistic Computing Divide: Configuring Oscillator Ising Machines as P-bit Engines; This work presents a theoretically grounded framework for configuring Oscillator Ising Machines (OIMs) as probabilistic bit (p-bit) engines by using a novel interplay between first- and second-harmonic injection.

Ferroelectric Memory Technology for Big Data Applications; This paper reviews the outstanding challenges and recent innovations in ferroelectric memory technology, a promising candidate for Big Data applications due to the discovery of ferroelectricity in hafnium dioxide (HfO2).

Different paths, same destination: Designing physics-inspired dynamical systems with engineered stability to minimize the Ising Hamiltonian; This work introduces the dynamical Ising machine (DIM), a physics-inspired system that, like the Oscillator Ising Machine, minimizes the Ising Hamiltonian but exhibits different dynamical properties to enhance computational performance.

Qualitative coding: An approach to assess inter-rater reliability; This study summarizes a practical approach for calculating inter-rater reliability (IRR) in qualitative coding when using non-specialized software like Microsoft Word and Excel, offering recommendations for research teams.

Undergraduate engineering students' perceptions of research and researchers; This paper explores how undergraduate engineering students in research experiences (UREs) perceive research and researchers, using identity and epistemic cognition as concepts to understand their views on knowledge creation.

Enhancing research quality through analytical memo writing in a mixed methods grounded theory study implemented by a multi-institution research team; This paper describes the use of analytical memo-writing in a mixed-methods grounded theory study to identify key elements from undergraduate research experiences (UREs) that can be translated into the classroom.

Elementary teachers' verbal supports of science and engineering practices in an NGSS‐aligned science, engineering, and computational thinking unit; This study explores how elementary teachers provide verbal support for science and engineering practices (SEPs) during an NGSS-aligned curricular unit that integrates science, engineering, and computational thinking.

Stigma of mental health conditions within engineering culture and its relation to help-seeking attitudes: Insights from the first year of a longitudinal study; This longitudinal study aims to quantitatively measure how the stigma of mental health conditions within engineering culture is negatively correlated with the help-seeking attitudes of undergraduate students.

Full Paper: What are we Teaching First Year Students? A Qualitative Analysis of Introductory Engineering Course Syllabi; This study performs a qualitative analysis of introductory engineering course syllabi from 13 institutions to understand what habits, mindsets, and technical skills are valued and communicated to first-year students.

Elements of engineering culture affecting undergraduate students' mental health and their help‐seeking attitudes; This study uses thematic analysis of interviews with engineering undergraduates to explore the specific mechanisms through which engineering culture can harm students' mental well-being and limit their help-seeking attitudes.

BYOE: Teaching and Assessing Troubleshooting Strategies in Circuits Courses; This paper details two breadboard-based laboratory experiments designed to explicitly teach and assess students’ use of various troubleshooting strategies in circuits courses to methodically identify and repair faults.

A Case Study of Elementary Teachers' Enactment of an NGSS-Aligned Computer Science Lesson: Verbal Support of Science, Engineering, Mathematics, and Computer Science Integration; This case study explores how two fifth-grade science teachers implicitly and explicitly support the integration of STEM and computer science disciplines through verbal supports during a CS-focused lesson.

Towards an EEG-based brain-computer interface for online robot control; This paper presents a novel EEG-based brain-computer interface (BCI) system using an Emotiv EPOC headset and online learning algorithms to classify thoughts and control a Lego Mindstorms robot.

A software-based sonar ranging sensor for smart phones; This paper proposes and evaluates a software-based sonar sensor for smart phones that uses the device's own microphone and speaker to accurately measure distances to objects without requiring custom hardware.

Prototyping wearables: A code-first approach to the design of embedded systems; This paper presents a code-first platform for rapid prototyping of wearable devices, where the required hardware is generated by analyzing the software application code written by the developer.

Ethical hacking: A hands-on introduction to breaking in; This book provides a hands-on guide to modern ethical hacking techniques, from network traffic capture and reverse shells to fuzzing and SQL injection, for aspiring penetration testers and security researchers.

Smartphone application launch with smarter scheduling; This paper presents a large-scale measurement study on Android I/O delay, finding that reads can be significantly slowed by concurrent writes, and proposes a pilot solution that reduces app launch delay by prioritizing reads.

Meme Magic: Project in Sprints; This paper describes Meme Magic, a series of six sprint-based assignments that provide progressive exposure to Java programming by having students build a fully-functional graphical meme generator.

Redesigning the online video lecture player to promote active learning; This work-in-progress paper examines student interaction patterns with online lecture videos and introduces a custom video player designed to promote active learning and provide instructor feedback.

Real-Time Encoding/Decoding for Pairwise Communication Over an Unreliable Sensor Network.; This paper proposes a real-time data compression algorithm for unreliable wireless sensor networks that exploits temporal locality to reduce the number of transmitted bytes and conserve energy.

Bond performance between ultrahigh-performance concrete and normal-strength concrete; This investigation focuses on the bond performance between ultrahigh-performance concrete (UHPC) and normal-strength concrete (NSC) for bridge deck overlays, demonstrating good long-term performance under various conditions.

Robust pixel-level crack detection using deep fully convolutional neural networks; This paper introduces CrackPix, a deep fully convolutional neural network for robust, pixel-level crack detection in concrete infrastructure, overcoming the limitations of coarse, patch-level models.

Evaluation of commercially available remote sensors for highway bridge condition assessment; This paper evaluates commercially available remote sensing technologies for their potential to improve the efficiency and safety of highway bridge condition assessment compared to current labor-intensive inspection techniques.

Increasing the robustness of material-specific deep learning models for crack detection across different materials; This paper focuses on increasing the robustness of deep learning-based crack detection models across different construction materials, moving beyond models tailored only to concrete or asphalt.

Structural system identification based on variational mode decomposition; This paper proposes a new structural identification method that uses variational mode decomposition (VMD) to decompose a dynamic response signal into distinct modal responses for identifying modal properties.

What lies within: Utilizing graph neural networks for subsurface detection in finite element simulations; This work introduces a strategy for identifying unseen subsurface damage in structural components by fusing traditional finite element simulations with graph neural networks (GNNs).

Iterative Updating of Digital Twins Using Convolutional Neural Networks: A Framework for Robust Structural Behavior Prediction; This study introduces a novel iterative updating strategy for digital twins, using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to predict structural behavior and bridge the gap between physical observations and virtual modeling.

Deep learning-based Visual Measurement Extraction within an Adaptive Digital Twin Framework from Limited Data Using Transfer Learning; This research proposes a novel approach using Convolutional Neural Networks and transfer learning to extract visual deformation measurements from speckle pattern images for adaptive digital twin frameworks.

Developing Augmented Reality Applications to Help Engineering Students Learn Spatial Structural Engineering Concepts; This project develops and evaluates STRUCT-AR, a mobile augmented reality (AR) application designed to help engineering students visualize and interact with complex 3D structural behaviors.

Urban flood extent segmentation and evaluation from real-world surveillance camera images using deep convolutional neural network; This study explores the use of Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (DCNNs) for semantic segmentation of urban flood extent from real-world surveillance camera images, achieving high accuracy but identifying challenges like specular reflection and low illumination.

Opening the terahertz window with integrated diode circuits; This paper reviews the importance of the terahertz frequency band and summarizes efforts to span the "terahertz technology gap," with an emphasis on solid-state integrated diode circuits.

Thin film lithium niobate electro-optic modulator with terahertz operating bandwidth; This paper presents a thin film lithium niobate electro-optic phase modulator that demonstrates an unprecedented measured response up to 500 GHz due to precise index matching between the RF and optical modes.

A 100-MESFET planar grid oscillator; This paper presents a 100-MESFET planar grid oscillator that combines power quasi-optically to produce 21 W of effective radiated power at 5 GHz with 20% efficiency.

Resonant metal-mesh bandpass filters for the far infrared; This paper presents the design and spectral performance of freestanding resonant metal-mesh bandpass filters for the far-infrared, demonstrating high transmission, strong stop-band rejection, and scalability.

A broadband quasi-optical terahertz detector utilizing a zero bias Schottky diode; This paper describes the design and characterization of a broadband quasi-optical terahertz detector using a zero-bias Schottky diode on a sinuous antenna, achieving high responsivity from 150-900 GHz.

Photonically driven pseudo-continuous and broadband THz phase shifting using spatially resolved photoconductivity modulation; This paper reports a novel approach for broadband THz phase shifting based on spatially-resolved photoconductivity modulation (SRPM), where changing the illumination area on a hybrid structure tunes the phase.

Fabrication and Characterization of Submillimeter-Wave GaAs Quasi-Vertical Schottky Diodes Diffusion Bonded to Silicon; This work presents the first metal-to-metal diffusion-bonded Gallium Arsenide quasi-vertical Schottky diode heterogeneously integrated onto high-resistivity silicon, demonstrating its suitability for high-frequency applications.
The IMS2024 Technical Program: A Celebration in Our Nation’s Capital of the Broad Spectrum and Diversity of Our Profession

Improved Process Flow of Heterogeneously Integrated Gallium Arsenide Schottky Diodes; This paper reports an improved process flow for fabricating heterogeneously integrated gallium arsenide Schottky diodes on silicon membranes, focusing on high packing density, co-fabrication of vias, and process simplification.

A 90-125 GHz Stacked PA in 130 nm InP HBT with 18.3% peak PAE at 15.3 dBm Output Power; This paper presents a wideband 90-125 GHz stacked power amplifier in a 130 nm InP HBT process, achieving 18.3% peak PAE and 15.3 dBm output power by aligning load line phases.

Distributed MEMS true-time delay phase shifters and wide-band switches; This paper describes the development of wide-band switches and true-time delay (TTD) phase shifters using distributed microelectromechanical system (MEMS) transmission lines for phased-array applications.

Optimization of distributed MEMS transmission-line phase shifters-U-band and W-band designs; This paper presents the design and optimization of distributed MEMS transmission-line phase shifters for U-band and W-band, demonstrating high figures of merit and identifying performance limitations.

A W-band dielectric-lens-based integrated monopulse radar receiver; This paper describes an integrated W-band monopulse radar receiver for tracking applications, based on dielectric-lens-supported slot-ring antennas integrated with subharmonic mixers, achieving excellent monopulse patterns.

A 60-GHz 2-bit Switched-Line Phase Shifter Using SP4T RF-MEMS Switches; This paper presents the design and measurement of a V-band 2-bit switched-line phase shifter that uses SP4T RF-MEMS switches, demonstrating an average insertion loss of 2.5 dB from 55-65 GHz.

Distributed MEMS tunable matching network using minimal-contact RF-MEMS varactors; This paper presents a double-slug tunable matching network based on a distributed MEMS transmission line, implemented with a new minimal-contact RF-MEMS varactor that largely eliminates stiction.

A Prototype Millimeter-Wave Reflectionless Diplexer Based on Silicon Micromachining; This paper reports the first millimeter-wave implementation of a prototype "quasi-reflectionless" diplexer, based on the reflectionless filter concept and utilizing a silicon-on-insulator micromachining platform.

A Millimeter-Wave “Quasi-Reflectionless” Filter Prototype Implemented with Micromachined Silicon; This paper describes a proof-of-concept "quasi-reflectionless" filter with a 150 GHz roll-off, implemented on a micromachined silicon-on-insulator (SOI) substrate and exhibiting a return loss greater than 15 dB.
IMS2024 Conference Themes
IMS2024 General Chairs’ Welcome

Modelling disease outbreaks in realistic urban social networks; This study models disease outbreaks using dynamic bipartite graphs generated from large-scale urban traffic simulations, finding that the scale-free nature of the locations network allows for highly efficient outbreak detection.

Modeling targeted layered containment of an influenza pandemic in the United States; This study uses three different individual-based simulation models to examine the effectiveness of targeted layered containment (TLC) strategies for mitigating an influenza pandemic in a large urban population.

Mobile Data Offloading through Opportunistic Communications and Social Participation; This paper proposes offloading mobile data traffic by exploiting opportunistic communications in Mobile Social Networks (MoSoNets), investigating the target-set selection problem to minimize cellular data usage.

Cellular traffic offloading through opportunistic communications: a case study; This case study investigates the target-set selection problem for offloading cellular traffic through opportunistic communications in Mobile Social Networks (MoSoNets) to reduce data delivery costs.

Beating the news' with EMBERS: Forecasting Civil Unrest using Open Source Indicators; This paper describes EMBERS, an automated, 24x7 system that successfully forecasts civil unrest in Latin America by using open-source indicators like tweets, news, and economic data.

Prediction of Hospital Associated Infections During Continuous Hospital Stays; This paper presents GenHAI, a novel generative probabilistic model for modeling sequences of MRSA test results during a single hospitalization to help mitigate the risk of hospital-associated infections.

Sample Complexity of Linear Regression Models for Opinion Formation in Networks; This paper initiates the study of sample complexity for opinion formation in networks, presenting a polynomial time optimization framework to quantify the total samples needed for opinion convergence in linear regression models.

UFID: A Unified Framework for Black-box Input-level Backdoor Detection on Diffusion Models; This paper proposes UFID, a unified framework for black-box, input-level backdoor detection on diffusion models that is motivated by a causal analysis of the attack's effect on the input-to-output path.

Graph-Based Prediction of Spatio-Temporal Vaccine Hesitancy From Insurance Claims Data; This paper develops the VaxHesSTL framework, a hybrid GNN-RNN model, to predict spatio-temporal vaccine hesitancy at the ZIP Code level using insurance claims and other public data.

SimPO: Simple preference optimization with a reference-free reward; This work proposes SimPO, a simple and effective preference optimization algorithm that uses the average log probability of a sequence as a reference-free implicit reward to align large language models.

Large language model as attributed training data generator: A tale of diversity and bias; This paper investigates using large language models with diversely attributed prompts to generate high-quality training data, finding it enhances model performance, reduces bias, and improves efficiency compared to simple prompts.

Text classification using label names only: A language model self-training approach; This paper proposes a self-training approach for text classification that uses only class label names by leveraging pre-trained language models to generate and generalize from category-indicative pseudo-labeled data.

Generating training data with language models: Towards zero-shot language understanding; This paper presents a zero-shot learning approach for NLU tasks where a unidirectional language model generates class-conditioned text to be used as training data for fine-tuning a bidirectional model.

Weakly-supervised neural text classification; This paper proposes a flexible weakly-supervised method for neural text classification that uses a pseudo-document generator for model pre-training and a self-training module for refinement to address the lack of labeled data.

Aligning Large Language Models via Fully Self-Synthetic Data; This work introduces Self-Alignment Optimization (SAO), a fully self-synthetic framework for LLM alignment where the model generates its own prompts, responses, and preferences for preference optimization.

Beyond Outcome Reward: Decoupling Search and Answering Improves LLM Agents; This paper introduces DeSA, a two-stage training framework for LLM agents that improves search and answering by decoupling the optimization of search behavior from final answer generation.

TruthRL: Incentivizing truthful LLMs via reinforcement learning; This work presents TruthRL, a reinforcement learning framework that directly optimizes LLM truthfulness by using a ternary reward to distinguish correct answers, hallucinations, and abstentions, thereby improving factual correctness and uncertainty recognition.

AdaDecode: Accelerating LLM Decoding with Adaptive Layer Parallelism; This work proposes AdaDecode, a method to accelerate LLM decoding by adaptively generating tokens at intermediate layers when prediction confidence is high, enabling parallel execution of subsequent computations.

The surprising effectiveness of negative reinforcement in LLM reasoning; This study on LLM reasoning surprisingly finds that reinforcement learning using only negative samples (NSR) can be highly effective, improving performance by suppressing incorrect generations and refining the model's prior knowledge.

Progress of large‐scale synthesis and electronic device application of two‐dimensional transition metal dichalcogenides; This review covers recent developments in the large-scale synthesis and electronic device application of two-dimensional transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs), discussing obstacles and advances in their electronic transport properties.

Transfer learning with Bayesian optimization-aided sampling for efficient AMS circuit modeling; This paper proposes using transfer learning with Bayesian optimization-aided sampling (BOAS) to create accurate neural network models for analog mixed-signal (AMS) circuits with a significantly reduced number of expensive SPICE simulations.

A Fractional-N Digital MDLL With Background Two-Point DTC Calibration; This article presents a fractional-N digital multiplying delay-locked loop (MDLL) featuring a background two-point DTC calibration to simultaneously correct gain and offset errors for a low-jitter, low-spur architecture.

From specification to silicon: Towards analog/mixed-signal design automation using surrogate NN models with transfer learning; This paper proposes and verifies a complete analog mixed-signal circuit design automation flow that uses transfer-learned neural network models to go from specification to silicon with minimal human interaction.

Fractional-N digital MDLL with injection-error scrambling and calibration; This article presents a fractional-N digital multiplying delay-locked loop (MDLL) that uses injection-error scrambling and a background third-order DTC delay equalizer to mitigate spurs while maintaining a low phase noise floor.
Dithering based digital to time converter linearization technique

Transient Hyperlogic Circuit: An Ultrafast and Metastability Self-Loopback Solver for NP-Hard Problems; This paper introduces the concept of a transient hyperlogic circuit, which adds a 'paradoxical' state to traditional logic to efficiently handle conflicts and solve NP-hard problems like Boolean satisfiability.

Stochastic TDC Using Common-Mode Time Dithering and Passive Approximate Adders; This article presents a 10-bit fully synthesizable stochastic time-to-digital converter (STDC) design that uses common-mode time dithering and passive approximate adders to reduce area and power costs.

Ultrafast Hybrid Computing Systems Enabled by Memristor‐Based Quadratic Programming Circuits; This research presents hybrid analog-digital computing platforms enabled by memristor-based quadratic programming circuits, demonstrating over 2000x speed-up on real-time control and machine learning algorithms.

Synthesizable 10-bit Stochastic TDC Using Common-Mode Time Dithering and Passive Approximate Adder with 0.012 mm 2 Active Area in 12nm FinFET; This paper presents a 10-bit fully synthesizable stochastic TDC (STDC) in 12nm FinFET that uses common-mode time dithering and a passive approximate adder to lower implementation cost while maintaining high linearity.

Perspectives on thermoelectrics: from fundamentals to device applications; This review updates progress in thermoelectrics, focusing on charge and heat carrier transport, strategies to improve the figure of merit ZT, and new discussions on device physics and applications.

Heat transport in silicon from first-principles calculations; This paper develops a general method to compute thermodynamic and thermal properties of crystals from first-principles calculations by using harmonic and anharmonic force constants to extract bulk thermal conductivity.

High thermoelectric performance by resonant dopant indium in nanostructured SnTe; This work demonstrates that indium doping in nanostructured SnTe creates resonant levels that enhance the Seebeck coefficient, leading to a significantly improved thermoelectric figure-of-merit (ZT) of ~1.1.

Resonant bonding leads to low lattice thermal conductivity; This paper uses first-principles calculations to reveal a link between resonant bonding and low lattice thermal conductivity in materials like lead chalcogenides, explaining their strong anharmonic scattering and low thermal conductivities.

Coherent phonon heat conduction in superlattices; This paper reports the first experimental observation of coherent phonon heat conduction by measuring a linear increase in thermal conductivity with the thickness of finite-thickness superlattices.

THERMACOND, a code to compute lattice thermal conductivity from harmonic and anharmonic force constants; This paper introduces THERMACOND, an open-source Fortran90 code for ab initio calculations of phonon thermal transport in crystalline materials by solving the linearized phonon Boltzmann transport equation.

Fundamentals and advances in thermal transport in thermoelectric materials; This article summarizes the fundamentals of heat flow in solid materials, including phonon scattering and the role of chemical bonding, and reviews theories for modeling thermal conductivity for thermoelectric applications.

ALATDYN: A set of Anharmonic LATtice DYNamics codes to compute thermodynamic and thermal transport properties of crystalline solids; This paper introduces ALATDYN, a lattice dynamics software package that calculates elastic, thermodynamic, and thermal transport properties of crystalline materials from their force and potential energy data.

Molecular dynamics study of sintering of faceted cubic boron nitride nanoparticles at high temperatures; This study uses classical molecular dynamics simulations to investigate the sintering mechanisms and temperature dependence of coalescing cubic boron nitride (c-BN) nanoparticles at high temperatures.

Neuroevolution machine learning potential to study high temperature deformation of entropy-stabilized oxide MgNiCoCuZnO5; This work develops and employs a neuroevolution machine learning potential (NEP) to study the high-temperature lattice distortion and elastic constants of the entropy-stabilized oxide MgNiCoCuZnO5.

M3detr: Multi-representation, multi-scale, mutual-relation 3d object detection with transformers; This paper presents M3DETR, a novel 3D object detection architecture that unifies multiple point cloud representations and feature scales using transformers to achieve state-of-the-art performance on the KITTI and Waymo datasets.

Emotions don't lie: An audio-visual deepfake detection method using affective cues; This paper presents an audio-visual deepfake detection method that uses a Siamese-inspired network to analyze the similarity of affective cues between audio and visual modalities, achieving high AUC on the DFDC and DF-TIMIT datasets.

Traphic: Trajectory prediction in dense and heterogeneous traffic using weighted interactions; This paper presents TraPHic, a novel LSTM-CNN hybrid network for predicting trajectories of heterogeneous road agents in dense traffic by modeling weighted and horizon-based interactions, outperforming state-of-the-art methods.

M3er: Multiplicative multimodal emotion recognition using facial, textual, and speech cues; This paper presents M3ER, a multiplicative multimodal emotion recognition method that robustly combines facial, textual, and speech cues by learning to emphasize reliable modalities and generate proxy features for noisy ones.

Forecasting trajectory and behavior of road-agents using spectral clustering in graph-lstms; This paper presents a novel approach for traffic forecasting that uses a two-stream graph-LSTM network on a dynamic geometric graph to predict both road-agent trajectories and high-level behaviors like overspeeding.

Safe In-Context Reinforcement Learning; This work proposes the first method to promote safety in in-context reinforcement learning (ICRL) by having the agent not only maximize reward but also minimize a cost function during its parameter-update-free adaptation process.

Towards Provable Emergence of In-Context Reinforcement Learning; This paper provides initial theoretical support for why RL pretraining can enable in-context reinforcement learning (ICRL) by proving that a global minimizer of the pretraining loss can enable in-context temporal difference learning.

Multi-Robot Navigation in Social Mini-Games: Definitions, Taxonomy, and Algorithms; This survey is the first to catalog and classify existing multi-robot navigation solvers for constrained social mini-games (SMGs) using a unified taxonomy, defining their properties and evaluation protocols.
System and method for detecting fabricated videos

Deadlock-free, safe, and decentralized multi-robot navigation in social mini-games via discrete-time control barrier functions; This paper presents a decentralized approach using discrete-time control barrier functions to ensure safe and deadlock-free multi-robot navigation in constrained social mini-games like doorways and intersections.

Catalytic fast pyrolysis of lignocellulosic biomass; This review discusses catalytic fast pyrolysis as an efficient process to convert lignocellulosic biomass into liquid hydrocarbon fuels, focusing on the challenge of removing oxygen from the resulting bio-oil.

Carbon-supported bimetallic Pd–Fe catalysts for vapor-phase hydrodeoxygenation of guaiacol; This study evaluates various carbon-supported metal catalysts for the vapor-phase hydrodeoxygenation of guaiacol, finding that bimetallic Pd-Fe catalysts exhibit enhanced activity while maintaining high selectivity to benzene.

Correlating Particle Size and Shape of Supported Ru/γ-Al2O3 Catalysts with NH3 Decomposition Activity; This study shows for the first time that controlling the particle shape of supported Ru/γ-Al2O3 catalysts is critical for maximizing the number of active B5 sites for ammonia decomposition.

Identification of the active complex for CO oxidation over single-atom Ir-on-MgAl2O4 catalysts; This study uses in situ and operando spectroscopy to identify the active single-atom complex in Ir/MgAl2O4 catalysts during low-temperature CO oxidation, revealing a unique reaction mechanism involving Ir(CO)3.

Aqueous phase reforming of glycerol for hydrogen production over Pt–Re supported on carbon; This study investigates hydrogen production from the aqueous phase reforming of glycerol over carbon-supported Pt-Re catalysts, finding that Re addition significantly increases glycerol conversion but at a loss of hydrogen selectivity.
Structural Evolution of Au-Pd Alloys in the Presence of CO

Reversible Temperature-Induced Shape Transition of Pt Nanoparticles Supported on Al2O3; This work combines in-situ spectroscopy and machine learning potentials to show that supported Pt nanoparticles on Al2O3 reversibly change shape from 3D hemispheres to 2D rafts with increasing temperature.

Single Metal Atom Catalysts Prepared by Diluted Atomic Layer Deposition; This paper introduces diluted atomic layer deposition (DALD), a scalable method for synthesizing supported single-atom catalysts by using a diluted precursor mixture to precisely control metal loading.

Low Levels of Zinc Exchanged into Cu‐SSZ‐13 Increase Methanol Production in the Partial Oxidation of Methane to Methanol; This study reports that exchanging small amounts of zinc into Cu-SSZ-13 catalysts leads to a marked increase of over 80% in methanol production from the partial oxidation of methane.
Effect of Metal Nuclearity on Bidirectional Metal-Support Interaction of Pt/CeO2 and Catalytic Properties

The model of gamification principles for digital health interventions: evaluation of validity and potential utility; This study examines the validity and reliability of a five-principle gamification model for digital health interventions by having independent raters evaluate 17 web- and mobile-based apps.

Principles of gamification for Internet interventions; This paper explores the construct of gamification for technology-based behavioral interventions, defining its core features and proposing a model for its application to enhance engagement and adherence.

Recognizing dialogue content in student collaborative conversation; This paper describes how an inquiry-learning tutor uses an expert knowledge base to recognize content in free-entry student collaborative conversations with high accuracy, supporting problem-solving activities.

Effects of a pathfinding program visualization on algorithm development; This paper evaluates the effectiveness of a pathfinding program visualization (PV) on student algorithm development in an undergraduate Artificial Intelligence course, analyzing artifacts produced with and without the PV.

Discs: A new sequence segmentation method for open-ended learning environments; This paper introduces DiSCS, a new differential sequence segmentation algorithm that finds and clusters meaningful periods of student activity from noisy log data in open-ended learning environments.

Origin of compressive residual stress in polycrystalline thin films; This paper presents a model for compressive stress generation in polycrystalline thin films where an increase in surface chemical potential from vapor deposition drives atoms into grain boundaries.

The dynamic competition between stress generation and relaxation mechanisms during coalescence of Volmer–Weber thin films; This study uses real-time stress measurements during Volmer-Weber thin film deposition to reveal a generic compressive-tensile-compressive stress evolution resulting from the competition between stress generation and relaxation mechanisms.

Extensions of the Stoney formula for substrate curvature to configurations with thin substrates or large deformations; This paper derives extensions to the Stoney formula for substrate curvature to account for configurations with thin substrates or large deformations, broadening its applicability for experimental interpretation.

Spontaneous pattern formation on ion bombarded Si (001); This study uses in-situ spectroscopic light scattering to monitor ripple evolution on ion-bombarded Si(001), allowing for the measurement of the surface migration energy as 1.2±0.1 eV.

Physical origins of intrinsic stresses in Volmer–Weber thin films; This article reviews the fundamental physical origins of intrinsic stresses in Volmer-Weber thin films, covering compressive stresses from surface-stress effects and tensile stresses from island coalescence and grain growth.

High thermoelectric power factor in Ni–Fe alloy for active cooling applications; This work uses machine learning to identify Ni-Fe as a promising metallic thermoelectric alloy and experimentally demonstrates a high power factor, making it a candidate for active cooling applications.

Ordered-Phase Equilibria in the Eutectoid Region of Bulk Fe-Pd; This report provides the first analysis of the equilibrium phase coexistence and microstructure in the L10 + L12 eutectoid region of bulk Fe-Pd, establishing L1' as a distinguishable phase.

Wetting of L10 twin and antiphase boundaries by nanometer-scale L12 in Fe-Pd alloys; This paper reports and analyzes the complex nanometer-scale wetting of L10 twin and antiphase boundaries by the L12 phase in the two-phase coexistence region of magnetic Fe-Pd alloys.

Thermoelectric properties of YbZn 11− x Al x; This paper reports for the first time the thermoelectric and transport properties of the intermetallic compound YbZn11, using band structure calculations and experimental measurements on Al-doped samples.

Direct evidence of the shockley tetragonal L1’phase in a bulk Fe-Pd alloy; This paper provides direct evidence from x-ray diffraction and transmission electron microscopy for the existence of the tetragonal L1' phase, first predicted by Shockley, in a bulk Fe-Pd alloy.

High temperature shape memory alloys; This paper reviews high-temperature shape memory alloys (HTSMAs) with transformation temperatures above 100°C, categorizing them into three groups and discussing the criteria for their application in various industries.

Processing parameters in laser powder bed fusion metal additive manufacturing; This manuscript reviews the effects of major processing parameters in laser powder bed fusion on build quality and material properties, serving as a guide for modifying parameters to achieve specific design goals.

Spatial Control of Functional Response in 4D-Printed Active Metallic Structures; This paper demonstrates a method for achieving spatial control of functional response in a 4D-printed metallic structure by using selective laser melting to create designed variations in thermal history and precipitate structure.

The effect of precipitates on the superelastic response of [100] oriented FeMnAlNi single crystals under compression; This work investigates the effect of B2 nanoprecipitates on the superelastic response of FeMnAlNi single crystals, finding that precipitate size, volume fraction, and composition strongly influence the material's properties.

A comparative study of the cytotoxicity and corrosion resistance of nickel–titanium and titanium–niobium shape memory alloys; This work provides a comparative study of the cytotoxicity and corrosion resistance of nickel-titanium (NiTi) and titanium-niobium (TiNb) shape memory alloys for biomedical applications.

Heterogeneous Microstructure in Laser-Processed Metastable Ti25Nb Alloy; This study uses transmission electron microscopy to reveal a heterogeneous microstructure with several metastable phases, including a novel orthorhombic phase, in a laser-processed metastable Ti25Nb alloy.

Effect of raster orientation on large-scale robotic 3D printing of short carbon fiber-reinforced PLA composites; This study examines the effect of raster orientation on the mechanical properties of large-scale 3D printed short carbon fiber-reinforced PLA, finding that a quasi-isotropic layup can improve weak properties.

Probabilistic printability maps for laser powder bed fusion via functional calibration and uncertainty propagation; This work develops a computational framework using a Bayesian approach and the Eagar-Tsai model to generate probabilistic printability maps for exploring the process space in laser powder bed fusion.

Morphogenic Modeling of Corrosion Reveals Complex Effects of Intermetallic Particles; This paper uses a novel excitable reaction-diffusion model to show that seemingly random corrosion processes are driven by the spatial distribution of micrometer-scale intermetallic particles that trigger or block corrosion waves.

Ampk phosphorylation of Ulk1 is required for targeting of mitochondria to lysosomes in exercise-induced mitophagy; This study shows that Ampk phosphorylation of Ulk1 is a required step for targeting mitochondria to lysosomes during exercise-induced mitophagy in skeletal muscle, a process preceded by mitochondrial oxidative stress.

Mapping macrophage polarization over the myocardial infarction time continuum; This study uses whole transcriptome analysis to map macrophage polarization over the first week of myocardial infarction (MI), revealing a unique pro-inflammatory, ECM-degrading signature at day 1 that shifts over time.

Identification of a novel mitochondrial uncoupler that does not depolarize the plasma membrane; This paper reports the identification and characterization of a novel mitochondrial uncoupler that, unlike canonical uncouplers, does not depolarize the plasma membrane, making it a valuable tool for studying mitochondrial respiration.

A novel MitoTimer reporter gene for mitochondrial content, structure, stress, and damage in vivo; This paper describes a novel MitoTimer reporter gene that encodes a mitochondria-targeted fluorescent protein that shifts from green to red when oxidized, allowing for in vivo assessment of mitochondrial stress and damage.

Modeling β-adrenergic control of cardiac myocyte contractility in silico; This study uses a validated kinetic model integrating β-adrenergic signaling with excitation-contraction coupling to perform a systems analysis of how the signaling network controls cardiac myocyte contractility.

Advances in Drug Discovery for Cardiomyocyte Proliferation; This article reviews recent advances in the discovery of candidate drugs that stimulate cardiomyocyte proliferation in pre-clinical animal models, emphasizing the need for basic research to translate these findings into effective therapies.

Flexible nanoelectronics reveal arrhythmogenesis in transplanted human cardiomyocytes; This study uses flexible mesh nanoelectronics to show that the self-assembling peptide RADA16 reduces arrhythmogenic automaticity and improves vascularization of transplanted human iPSC-cardiomyocytes in rat hearts.

Single-cell dynamics reveal a stress-induced decision between hypertrophy and apoptosis in neonatal rat cardiomyocytes; This study uses high-content microscopy to track single-cell dynamics of neonatal rat cardiomyocytes, revealing a stress-induced decision between hypertrophy and apoptosis that is governed by a biphasic population-level response.

MEF2C controls segment-specific gene regulatory networks that direct heart tube morphogenesis; This study uses single-nucleus multiomics and a deep learning model to define the segment-specific gene regulatory networks controlled by the transcription factor MEF2C that direct heart tube morphogenesis.

Network Modeling Predicts How DYRK1A Inhibition Promotes Cardiomyocyte Cycling after Ischemic/Reperfusion Injury; This study uses a computational network model and experimental validation to show that pharmacological inhibition of DYRK1A promotes cardiomyocyte cell cycle re-entry and improves heart function after ischemia/reperfusion injury.

Young African American children's representations of self, science, and school: Making sense of difference; This study uses conversations around science journals to explore how young, low-income African American children construct their identities relative to the practices of science and the dominant narrative of "doing school."

Teaching manuals and the blackboard: Accessing historical classroom practices; This paper analyzes turn-of-the-century teaching manuals to access historical classroom practices, showing how the blackboard was transformed into a teaching necessity for large-group learning in nineteenth-century England.

‘The artist’s piece is already in the stone’: Constructing creativity in paleontology laboratories; This paper investigates how vertebrate paleontology technicians, or 'fossil preparators,' construct their work in terms of creativity and artistry, challenging the typical portrayal of technicians as invisible manual laborers.

Young black children and science: Chronotopes of narratives around their science journals; This study uses Bakhtin's construct of chronotopes to analyze the spoken narratives of young Black children around their science journals, exploring the space-time relationships that constitute their identification with science.

Preparing dinosaurs: The work behind the scenes; This book investigates the skilled and creative labor of fossil preparators, arguing for a new model of science that acknowledges the often-unrecognized work and workers behind foundational scientific evidence.

Earth Sciences from the Perspectives of Science and Technology Studies; This chapter outlines how the discipline of science and technology studies (STS) can provide historians with methodological approaches and theoretical frameworks to access key aspects of the Earth sciences.

Using REU Program Evaluation to Foster Learning through Reflection; This paper explores whether REU program evaluation can be designed as a multi-purpose tool to not only assess the program but also provide research data and foster student learning through reflection.

We have been here Before: Reflections on Engineering and Authoritarianism; This article reflects on the chaos in the US research and education apparatus following the inauguration of the 47th president, drawing parallels to historical instances of engineering and authoritarianism.

Timing science: The temporal role of scientists in the construction of data; This paper proposes a model for analyzing how scientific practitioners' conceptions of time reflect the personal, professional, and epistemic values that guide their decisions in the construction of data.

REU Program Evaluation: A Valuable Tool for Studying Undergraduate Socialization in Engineering; This work-in-progress paper introduces a project to study how a summer REU program in materials science relates to undergraduate students' sense of identity, belonging, and understanding of the research process.

Sampling dead block prediction for last-level caches; This paper introduces sampling dead block prediction, a technique that uses program counters to accurately predict when a last-level cache block is dead, significantly reducing LLC misses with less state than previous predictors.
Adaptive-Latency DRAM: Optimizing DRAM Timing for the Common-Case

Accelerating Pointer Chasing in 3D-Stacked Memory: Challenges, Mechanisms, Evaluation; This paper proposes the In-Memory Pointer Chasing Accelerator (IMPICA), which leverages the logic layer of 3D-stacked memory to accelerate linked data structure traversal by performing it inside main memory.
AVATAR: A Variable-Retention-Time (VRT) Aware Refresh for DRAM Systems

Understanding latency variation in modern DRAM chips: Experimental characterization, analysis, and optimization; This work experimentally characterizes and analyzes the significant latency variation for fundamental DRAM operations across the cells of a single chip, proposing optimizations to exploit this common-case behavior.

SLOs-Serve: Optimized Serving of Multi-SLO LLMs; This paper introduces SLOs-Serve, a system that uses a dynamic programming algorithm to optimize the serving of multi-stage LLM requests by customizing token allocations to meet stage-specific service level objectives (SLOs).

EdgeRAG: Online-Indexed RAG for Edge Devices; This work proposes EdgeRAG, a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) system for edge devices that addresses memory constraints by pruning embeddings and generating them on-demand, significantly reducing latency.

Office Hours and Online Forum Engagement in Introductory CS Courses; This paper argues that redesigning the host-NIC interface is necessary to benefit from emerging cache-coherent interconnects, as current access patterns lead to extraneous communication and limit performance.

A Cloud-Scale Characterization of Remote Procedure Calls; This paper presents the first large-scale, fleet-wide characterization of Remote Procedure Calls (RPCs) in a modern cloud environment, providing insights into their behavior and characteristics "in the wild."

vPIM: Efficient Virtual Address Translation for Scalable Processing-in-Memory Architectures; This work proposes vPIM, an efficient virtual address translation scheme for scalable, multi-stack processing-in-memory (PIM) systems that optimizes memory network contention and reduces translation time with pre-translation.

The internet of things has a gateway problem; This paper argues that the current application-layer gateway approach to IoT connectivity is not scalable and proposes a new architecture that disentangles network connectivity, in-network processing, and user interface functions.

Multiprogramming a 64kb computer safely and efficiently; This paper introduces Tock, a new operating system for low-power microcontrollers that uses hardware protection and the Rust language to provide fault isolation, memory protection, and dynamic memory management.

Graph neural networks in IoT: A survey; This paper surveys the application of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in the Internet of Things (IoT), where they can capture complex interactions within sensor topologies to achieve state-of-the-art performance.

Is rust used safely by software developers?; This large-scale empirical study explores how software developers use Unsafe Rust in real-world libraries, finding that while the keyword is used in less than 30% of libraries, over half cannot be entirely statically checked.

Surepoint: Exploiting ultra wideband flooding and diversity to provide robust, scalable, high-fidelity indoor localization; This paper presents SurePoint, a high-fidelity indoor localization system that uses ultra-wideband radio with frequency and spatial diversity and an efficient broadcast ranging protocol to achieve sub-meter accuracy.

Data Efficient PV based Indoor Event Detection; This paper investigates data-efficient indoor event detection by using signature voltage patterns from a PV module, proposing an intelligent on-board algorithm that prioritizes sampling points to improve accuracy and efficiency.

Atlas: Ensuring Accuracy for Privacy-Preserving Federated IoT Applications; This paper presents Atlas, a private and accurate personalized federated learning framework for IoT applications that uses a layer importance mask to preserve user privacy without compromising model accuracy.

Detecting Plant VOC Traces Using Indoor Air Quality Sensors; This research leverages commercial indoor air quality sensors and machine learning to detect and classify plant-emitted volatile organic compounds (VOCs), establishing a foundation for advanced plant-based environmental sensors.
Scheduling energy harvesting nodes in a wireless sensor network

Injury-induced HDAC5 nuclear export is essential for axon regeneration; This study reveals that axon injury elicits a back-propagating calcium wave that causes the essential nuclear export of HDAC5, which in turn enhances histone acetylation to activate a pro-regenerative gene program.

Avoiding common pitfalls when clustering biological data; This paper reviews common pitfalls in the application of clustering to high-throughput biological data, such as failing to consider multiple methods, and presents methods to avoid them to prevent wasted resources.

Phosphoproteomics of collagen receptor networks reveals SHP-2 phosphorylation downstream of wild-type DDR2 and its lung cancer mutants; This study uses quantitative phosphoproteomics to analyze collagen receptor signaling networks, identifying SHP-2 phosphorylation as a candidate downstream signaling node of the DDR2 receptor and its lung cancer mutants.

Different Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Agonists Produce Unique Signatures for the Recruitment of Downstream Signaling Proteins*♦; This study uses luciferase fragment complementation imaging to show that different EGF receptor agonists produce unique temporal signatures for the recruitment of downstream signaling proteins, which could explain their differing biological effects.

Predicting patient response to the antiarrhythmic mexiletine based on genetic variation: personalized medicine for long QT syndrome; This study uses a systems-based approach to understand the molecular basis of variable patient response to the antiarrhythmic drug mexiletine, building a predictive statistical model to personalize treatment for long QT syndrome.

Informatics at the Frontier of Cancer Research; This paper reviews current and emerging informatics technology developments for cancer research, spanning molecular characterization, image analysis, and therapeutics, and identifies themes for the next generation of research.

Uncovering the domain language of protein functionality and cell phenotypes using DANSy; This paper introduces DANSy, a linguistic approach that represents the human proteome as an n-gram network of protein domains to uncover the abstract rules of domain combinations that determine protein functionality.
Ten simple rules for effectively assessing lab environments

Systematic analysis of the effects of splicing on the diversity of post-translational modifications in protein isoforms using PTM-POSE; This paper introduces PTM-POSE, a tool to explore the interplay between post-translational modifications (PTMs) and splicing, revealing how splicing diversifies PTMs and potentially rewires protein-interaction networks.

Structure-informed theoretical modeling defines principles governing avidity in bivalent protein interactions; This study integrates mechanistic modeling and structure-based analysis to define the principles governing avidity in bivalent protein interactions, using the tandem SH2 domain family as a multivalent archetype.

Social sustainability considerations during planning and design: Framework of processes for construction projects; This research applies the concept mapping method to develop a comprehensive framework of 50 processes for integrating and evaluating social sustainability considerations during the planning and design of construction projects.

People systematically overlook subtractive changes; This paper shows through a series of eight experiments that when trying to make improvements, people systematically default to searching for additive transformations and consequently overlook advantageous subtractive changes.

A framework for sustainable whole systems design; This paper describes a framework for sustainable whole systems design, organizing 20 elements identified from a literature review into categories of processes, principles, and methods to enable its widespread application.

The impact of process mapping on transparency; This research provides evidence and a methodology for evaluating the impact of process mapping on organizational transparency, finding that it can increase transparency by 5% to 27% in the studied applications.

A lean modeling protocol for evaluating green project delivery; This paper outlines a detailed lean modeling protocol for evaluating the delivery processes of green building projects, which are often laden with hidden waste and difficult to model with current techniques.

Exploring an intervention to increase psychological safety on student engineering design teams; This paper tests an improv theater-based intervention designed to increase psychological safety on student engineering design teams using a randomized controlled trial.

Informing Just Design with Place-Based Racial History; This article argues for a climate adaptation approach for frontline communities that prioritizes need-based distributive justice, informed by an understanding of place-based racial history.

Recycling bias and reduction neglect; This research finds strong evidence for a "recycling bias" and "reduction neglect," where most people erroneously perceive recycling as the most sustainable action to manage waste, while under-appreciating waste reduction.

Community involvement in coastal infrastructure adaptation should balance necessary complexity and perceived effort; This online experiment finds that a multifaceted risk perception questionnaire for coastal infrastructure adaptation imposes more cognitive strain on participants without providing different input than a single question, potentially discouraging public participation.

Framing to reduce present bias in infrastructure design intentions; This study finds that using a future-framed project description leads infrastructure professionals to propose significantly longer design lives, suggesting a simple way to lessen present bias in design.

Privacy-preserving distributed linear regression on high-dimensional data; This paper proposes a scalable, hybrid multi-party computation protocol for privacy-preserving distributed linear regression on high-dimensional data, using a new Conjugate Gradient Descent algorithm suitable for secure computation.

Scaling ORAM for secure computation; This paper designs and implements a Distributed Oblivious Random Access Memory (DORAM) data structure optimized for two-party secure computation, significantly improving access time, memory overhead, and initialization time over previous constructions.

Secure two-party threshold ECDSA from ECDSA assumptions; This paper proposes new, custom protocols for two-party threshold ECDSA key-generation and signing that are proven secure against malicious adversaries using only standard ECDSA-related cryptographic assumptions.

Threshold ECDSA from ECDSA assumptions: The multiparty case; This paper extends a previous two-party threshold ECDSA scheme to arbitrary thresholds, proving it secure against a malicious adversary under only the Computational Diffie-Hellman assumption in the Random Oracle model.

Revisiting square-root ORAM: efficient random access in multi-party computation; This paper shows how the classical square-root ORAM of Goldreich and Ostrovsky can be modified to provide an efficient solution for hiding memory access patterns in multi-party computation, overcoming the high costs of prior schemes.

From OT to OLE with Subquadratic Communication; This paper revisits the reduction of Oblivious Linear Evaluation (OLE) to Oblivious Transfer (OT), proposing a new method based on the Chinese Remainder Theorem that improves communication cost and is secured against malicious receivers.

Sometimes you can’t distribute random-oracle-based proofs; This paper investigates the conditions for creating multiparty realizations of NIZKs in the random oracle model, showing a fundamental barrier to constructing efficient, black-box protocols secure against all-but-one corruptions.

Secure multiparty computation with identifiable abort via vindicating release; This paper introduces input-revealing identifiable abort (IRIA), a weaker notion of identifiable abort for secure multiparty computation that can be achieved with small overheads through a technique called vindicating release.

Threshold ECDSA in three rounds; This paper presents a three-round protocol for threshold ECDSA signing with malicious security that combines an intermediate signature representation with an efficient statistical consistency check and a two-round vectorized multiplication protocol.

Constant-round simulation-secure coin tossing extension with guaranteed output; This paper initiates the study of fully-secure coin tossing extension (CTE) protocols, proving that statistical, black-box secure CTE with superlogarithmic stretch requires superconstant rounds, and then constructing a constant-round computational protocol.

Acellular normal and fibrotic human lung matrices as a culture system for in vitro investigation; This paper develops and validates a novel in vitro culture system using acellular normal and fibrotic human lung matrices to investigate how disease-specific extracellular matrix influences fibroblast phenotype.

Maleimide cross-linked bioactive PEG hydrogel exhibits improved reaction kinetics and cross-linking for cell encapsulation and in-situ delivery; This paper describes an engineered polyethylene glycol-maleimide hydrogel that exhibits improved reaction kinetics and a wider range of Young's moduli, making it advantageous for cell encapsulation and in-situ delivery.

Matrix stiffness–induced myofibroblast differentiation is mediated by intrinsic mechanotransduction; This study investigates the intrinsic mechanisms of mechanotransduction in matrix stiffness-induced myofibroblast differentiation, finding that it is mediated by MKL1 nuclear translocation and its binding to the α-SMA gene promoter.

Controlling integrin specificity and stem cell differentiation in 2D and 3D environments through regulation of fibronectin domain stability; This study shows that the structural stability of fibronectin's central cell-binding domains can be modulated to control integrin specificity, thereby directing stem cell differentiation in 2D and 3D environments.

Macrophage and fibroblast interactions in biomaterial‐mediated fibrosis; This review discusses the signaling pathways and spatiotemporal crosstalk between macrophages and fibroblasts, the primary cells involved in the biomaterial-mediated foreign body response and fibrous encapsulation.

Active antigen-specific adaptive immune responses are shared among patients with progressive fibrotic interstitial lung disease; This study analyzes lung-associated lymph nodes from patients with interstitial lung disease (ILD), finding that active, antigen-specific adaptive immune responses are shared among patients with progressive fibrotic ILD, including IPF.
Compositions and methods for detecting and regulating fibronectin-integrin interaction and signaling

Biomechanical properties of the capsule and extracellular matrix play a major role during the Wolffian/epididymal duct development; This study measures the structural stiffness of the capsule and extracellular matrix surrounding the developing Wolffian duct, hypothesizing that this biomechanical property is a major regulator of the organ's morphogenesis.

Multiscale computational model predicts how environmental changes and treatments affect microvascular remodeling in fibrotic disease; This paper integrates a multiscale computational model with experiments to predict how biomechanical and biochemical cues in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) alter cell fate decisions, leading to microvascular remodeling.

Fibroblast mechanoperception instructs pulmonary developmental and pattern specification gene expression programs; This study uses parallel ATAC- and RNA-sequencing to show that impaired fibroblast mechanoperception, modeled by Thy-1 loss, elicits a near-complete shutdown of the developmental transcription factor HOXA5.

Reducing food loss and waste to enhance food security and environmental sustainability; This paper reviews recent literature to highlight the importance of food loss and waste (FLW) reduction as a complementary solution to enhance both food security and environmental sustainability.

Understanding and managing the food-energy-water nexus–opportunities for water resources research; This paper explores how the food-energy-water (FEW) nexus paradigm provides opportunities for water resources researchers to engage in interdisciplinary research and apply their unique skillset to manage linked systems.

Impacts of climate change on agricultural water management: a review; This review provides an overview of the impacts of climate change on agricultural water management, including effects on water requirement, availability, and quality, and the resulting transitions in crop and livestock production.

Socio-hydrology: a new understanding to unite or a new science to divide?; This paper overviews general concerns about the originality and contributions of socio-hydrology, arguing that while the field promotes considering humans in water systems, its current trends may make it less inclusive and interdisciplinary.

Assessing the value of seasonal climate forecast information through an end‐to‐end forecasting framework: Application to US 2012 drought in central Illinois; This study proposes an end-to-end forecasting framework that couples a crop growth model with a decision model to translate seasonal climate forecasts into user-related information for farmers.
Advancing the Use of Hydroclimatic Forecasts for Water Resources Decision-Making II Oral

End-to-End Graph Neural Networks for Real-Time Hydraulic Prediction in Stormwater Systems; This paper presents GNN-SWS, a novel end-to-end graph neural network surrogate model that emulates rainfall-driven hydraulic behavior across stormwater systems for real-time prediction and flood mitigation.

Multi-fidelity graph neural networks for efficient and accurate flood hazard mapping; This study proposes a novel multi-fidelity graph neural network (MFGNN) framework that integrates numerous low-fidelity simulations with a few high-fidelity runs to create accurate flood hazard maps with limited data.

Evaluating the suitability of direct air carbon capture and storage in Virginia using geospatial multi-criteria decision analysis; This study develops a framework combining geospatial analysis with Multi-Criteria Decision Analysis (MCDA) to facilitate a detailed, localized suitability analysis for Direct Air Carbon Capture and Storage (DACCS) implementation in Virginia.

Deep learning-based downscaling of global digital elevation models for enhanced urban flood modeling; This study introduces a novel methodology using a Convolutional Neural Network (U-Net) to downscale Global Digital Elevation Models (GDEMs) for enhanced, high-resolution urban flood modeling.

A 3D model of muscle reveals the causes of nonuniform strains in the biceps brachii; This study uses a three-dimensional finite-element model of the biceps brachii to show that nonuniform muscle fascicle shortening is caused by variations in fascicle lengths and curvature.

Three-dimensional representation of complex muscle architectures and geometries; This work develops and evaluates a new method for creating three-dimensional finite-element models from MR images that represent complex muscle geometry and the variation in moment arms across fibers within a muscle.

Relationships of 35 lower limb muscles to height and body mass quantified using MRI; This study uses fast-acquisition MRI to quantify the volumes and lengths of 35 lower limb muscles in 24 healthy subjects, determining how muscle architecture scales with subject height and mass.

Accuracy of muscle moment arms estimated from MRI‐based musculoskeletal models of the lower extremity; This study develops and validates methods to construct subject-specific biomechanical models from MR images, quantifying the accuracy of muscle-tendon lengths and moment arms estimated from the models.

Image‐based musculoskeletal modeling: applications, advances, and future opportunities; This article reviews how MRI is revolutionizing the field of musculoskeletal modeling by providing novel methods for acquiring data on anatomy, muscle architecture, and joint motions from living subjects.

A shape-based functional index for objective assessment of pediatric motor function; This paper introduces a novel shape-based functional index using wearable sensors and Principal Component Analysis to objectively assess pediatric motor function in patients with neuromuscular disorders like DMD and SMA.

A deep learning algorithm for automatic 3D segmentation and quantification of hamstrings musculotendon injury from MRI; This study develops and deploys an automated artificial intelligence (AI) model to segment and quantify hamstring musculotendon injury and edema from MRI scans of collegiate football athletes.

Electrical impedance myography captures features of muscle structure measured by MRI and transcriptomic analysis in facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy; This multi-center cross-sectional study investigates whether electrical impedance myography (EIM) parameters are associated with muscle structure measured by MRI, histology, and transcriptomics in patients with FSHD.

214PMulti-scale machine learning model predicts muscle and functional disease progression in FSHD; This study introduces a multi-scale machine learning framework that leverages whole-body MRI and clinical data to predict regional, muscle, and functional disease progression in FSHD, creating a 'digital twin' for individual patients.

3D finite element models reveal regional fatty infiltration modulates tibialis anterior force generating capacity in FSHD; This study uses subject-specific 3D finite element models to reveal that the regional distribution of fatty infiltration, not just the total amount, modulates the force-generating capacity of the tibialis anterior muscle in FSHD.

Roadmap of optical communications; This article presents a roadmap of optical communications, inviting 16 experts to provide their perspectives on the diverse and rapidly changing field, from global networks to datacenter interconnects.

Free-space optical MIMO transmission with Q-ary PPM; This paper studies free-space optical MIMO transmission using repetition Q-ary PPM to combat fading on turbulent channels, analyzing error probability and constrained channel capacity for Rayleigh and log-normal fading models.

Volterra series transfer function of single-mode fibers; This paper presents a nonrecursive Volterra series transfer function (VSTF) approach for solving the nonlinear Schrödinger wave equation, providing a tool for designing optical systems and equalizers to compensate for dispersion and nonlinearities.

Optical repetition MIMO transmission with multipulse PPM; This paper studies optical repetition MIMO transmission with multipulse PPM, showing that this power-efficient format naturally obtains full spatial diversity for combating fading on turbulent atmospheric channels.

Monopulse DOA estimation of two unresolved Rayleigh targets; This paper develops new monopulse processing approaches for direction-of-arrival (DOA) estimation of two unresolved Rayleigh targets, using the Cramer Rao lower bound to give insight into optimal boresight pointing.

Physical-Layer Impairment Estimation for Arbitrary Spectral-Shaped Signals in C+ L-Band Optical Networks; This paper addresses the inaccuracy of the ISRS-GN model for non-rectangular signals by developing a new PLI estimation model for arbitrary spectral-shaped signals in C+L-band optical networks.

Modeling Nonlinear Noise for Arbitrary Pulse Shapes in Optical Fiber Communication Systems; This paper introduces a modulation-format-dependent nonlinear noise model that accounts for the impact of arbitrary, non-rectangular pulse shapes on fiber nonlinearity, improving NLI estimation accuracy.

ISRS-Enhanced PLI-Aware Routing for Multi-Band Elastic Optical Networks; This paper proposes an ISRS-Enhanced PLI-Aware (IE-PLIA) routing algorithm for multi-band elastic optical networks that dynamically adjusts routing costs based on physical layer impairments influenced by ISRS.

Angle diversity receiver as a key enabler for reliable ORIS-based Visible Light Communication; This paper investigates the use of angle diversity receivers (ADRs) and optical reconfigurable intelligent surfaces (ORISs) to mitigate link blockages in multiuser VLC systems, showing significant SNR gains.

Channel-Based ICXT-and NLI-Aware Service Provisioning for Multi-Band Over SDM Systems; This paper introduces a novel, channel-based resource allocation framework for multi-band over space-division multiplexing optical networks that addresses ICXT, ISRS, and nonlinear impairments to optimize performance.

Bayesian networks for system reliability reassessment; This paper proposes a methodology to apply Bayesian networks for structural system reliability reassessment, incorporating multiple failure sequences and correlations between component-level limit states.

Efficient first-order reliability analysis of multidisciplinary systems; This paper develops two efficient first-order reliability analysis algorithms for complex multidisciplinary engineering systems with feedback coupling, using a decoupling approach to reduce computational effort.
Probabilistic methods for aerospace system conceptual design
Integrating system-level and component-level designs under uncertainty

System risk assessment and allocation in conceptual design; This study investigates and demonstrates probabilistic analysis and optimization tools for the multidisciplinary design of aerospace systems, including a reusable launch vehicle and a Navy missile system.

Teamwork Development and Evaluation for Hybrid Thermal Fluids Laboratory Course; This paper discusses the development and evaluation of teamwork skills in a hybrid thermal fluids laboratory course, which serves as an ideal platform for practicing essential engineering skills.

Integration of Instructional Technology Tools Including Matlab Grader to Enhance Learning in a Hybrid Vibrations Course; This paper discusses the use of instructional technology tools, including Matlab Grader and Zoom, to enhance learning and provide real-time feedback in a hybrid graduate-level Vibrations course.

Scaffolded Laboratory Sequence: Mechanics Lab; This paper describes a new scaffolded laboratory sequence for undergraduate engineering, including a Mechanics Lab designed to supplement a lecture-based theory course and build skills for later labs.

Guided Peer Review of Technical Writing for Large Laboratory Course; This paper discusses the benefits and challenges of using guided peer review for technical writing in a large laboratory course to teach and assess experimental design and communication skills.

Design and implementation of a course in experimental design and technical writing; This paper describes the development and implementation of a sophomore-level laboratory course in Experimental Design and Technical Writing to improve communication skills and provide an experiential learning component.

Identifying wireless users via transmitter imperfections; This paper details a model-based approach using statistical signal processing to identify wireless users by exploiting nonlinearities and imperfections in their RF transmitters as a unique signature.

Fc glycan-mediated regulation of placental antibody transfer; This study uses systems serology to show that the selective placental transfer of antibodies to the fetus is mediated by digalactosylated Fc-glycans, which favor the transfer of NK cell-activating antibodies.

Exploring approaches for predictive cancer patient digital twins: opportunities for collaboration and innovation; This paper provides an early progress report on several Cancer Patient Digital Twin (CPDT) pilot projects, yielding insights into the opportunities and challenges in personalizing cancer treatment through computational modeling.

Small-molecule control of antibody N-glycosylation in engineered mammalian cells; This study engineered CHO cells with synthetic genetic circuits to achieve simultaneous and independent small-molecule control of fucosylation and galactosylation, two critical N-glycosylation attributes of monoclonal antibodies.

Dissecting N-glycosylation dynamics in Chinese hamster ovary cells fed-batch cultures using time course omics analyses; This study employs an integrative, multi-dimensional omics analysis to dissect the temporal dynamics of N-glycosylation in CHO cell fed-batch cultures, identifying key pathways and factors influencing glycoform production.

A flexible systems analysis pipeline for elucidating spatial relationships in the tumor microenvironment linked with cellular phenotypes and patient-level features; This paper presents a flexible computational pipeline that uses multiplexed imaging and interpretable machine learning to quantify and analyze spatial relationships in the tumor microenvironment that are predictive of cell states and clinical phenotypes.

Uncovering Cellular Interactome Drivers of Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Response in Advanced Melanoma Patients; This study uses interaction inference on single-cell RNA-sequencing data from melanoma patients to identify cellular interactome network motifs that predict response to immune checkpoint inhibitors.

LAG3+ CD8+ T cell subset drives HR+/HER2− breast cancer reduction in bispecific antibody armed activated T cell therapy; This study develops a kinetic-dynamic model using single-cell transcriptomics to identify that a LAG3+ CD8+ T cell subset drives breast cancer reduction in bispecific antibody armed T cell (BAT) therapy.
Abstract 2046 The long and winding road that led me to my systems immunology laboratory

Distinct type 1 immune networks underlie the severity of restrictive lung disease after COVID-19; This study analyzes cellular and molecular features in post-COVID patients, identifying two distinct restrictive lung disease phenotypes underpinned by divergent type 1 immune networks and T cell responses.

Structural determinants of glomerular permeability; This review discusses progress in relating the functional properties of the glomerular capillary wall to its unique structure, including a hydrodynamic model that predicts hydraulic permeability based on morphometric findings.

Reactivation of ERK signaling causes resistance to EGFR kinase inhibitors; This study shows that resistance to the EGFR kinase inhibitor WZ4002 develops through aberrant reactivation of ERK signaling, and that inhibiting MEK or ERK restores drug sensitivity.
