ERK1/2 blockade prevents epithelial–mesenchymal transition in lung cancer cells and promotes their sensitivity to EGFR inhibition; This study demonstrates that ERK1/2 signaling directs the mesenchymal character of NSCLC cells and that blocking this pathway is sufficient to prevent EMT and heighten therapeutic responses to EGFR inhibitors.

Cell signaling regulation by protein phosphorylation: a multivariate, heterogeneous, and context-dependent process; This review highlights the complexities of cell signaling regulation by protein phosphorylation, describing it as a multivariate, heterogeneous, and context-dependent process that requires specialized measurement techniques to study.

p53Ψ is a transcriptionally inactive p53 isoform able to reprogram cells toward a metastatic-like state; This paper describes p53Ψ, a transcriptionally inactive p53 isoform generated by alternative splicing that can reprogram cells toward a metastatic-like state by enhancing motility and invasion.

The kinase ERK plays a conserved dominant role in the heterogeneity of epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreatic cancer cells; This study combines iterative immunofluorescence imaging and mutual information analysis to show that cell-to-cell variation in ERK activity plays a conserved, dominant role in the heterogeneity of EMT in pancreatic cancer cells.
Engineering suicide gene approaches to improve chemotherapeutic response in cancer

Synergistic activity of simvastatin and irinotecan chemotherapy against glioblastoma converges on TGF-β signaling; This study investigates the synergistic therapeutic potential of simvastatin and irinotecan against glioblastoma, finding through RNA-Sequencing that their combined activity converges on the TGF-β signaling pathway.

ERK plays a conserved dominant role in pancreas cancer cell EMT heterogeneity driven by diverse growth factors and chemotherapies; This work uses iterative immunofluorescence imaging and mutual information modeling to show that cell-to-cell variation in ERK activity plays a dominant role in controlling EMT heterogeneity in pancreas cancer cells.

Hypoxia-induced histone methylation and NF-κB activation in pancreas cancer fibroblasts promote EMT-supportive growth factor secretion; This study shows that in pancreatic cancer, hypoxic fibroblasts leverage histone methylation and NF-κB activation to secrete growth factors that promote epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in malignant cells.

Robustness of attack-resilient state estimators; This work presents an attack-resilient state estimator for cyber-physical systems with noise and modeling errors, showing that an attacker cannot destabilize the system by exploiting the model-reality gap.

Design and implementation of attack-resilient cyberphysical systems: With a focus on attack-resilient state estimators; This article discusses the design and implementation of attack-resilient cyber-physical systems, with a focus on attack-resilient state estimators that can handle the complexity and heterogeneity of modern control systems.

Attack resilient state estimation for autonomous robotic systems; This paper presents a control-level methodology for autonomous ground robots to guarantee resilience against malicious sensor attacks by using a recursive filtering technique that leverages information redundancy.

A cooperative heterogeneous mobile wireless mechatronic system; This paper describes a framework for controlling a cooperative heterogeneous wireless robotic network of aerial and ground vehicles, presenting strategies for decentralized connectivity and autonomous communications relay.

Online planning for energy-efficient and disturbance-aware uav operations; This paper investigates an online planning problem for energy-efficient UAV operations, using a model predictive controller to estimate energy costs and a self-triggered scheduling policy to determine replanning times.

Corridor-based Adaptive Control Barrier and Lyapunov Functions for Safe Mobile Robot Navigation; This paper proposes a Control Lyapunov and Barrier Function (CLF-CBF) enabled MPCC framework for safe mobile robot navigation that enforces safety constraints derived from a free-space corridor and adapts CBF parameters using a SAC policy.

Optimal reference tracking with arbitrary sampling; This paper proposes a method to determine the optimal sequence of discrete-time references for a system to track a continuous-time trajectory with arbitrary sampling, minimizing the weighted L2 distance between them.

Take Your Best Shot: Sampling-Based Planning for Autonomous Photography; This paper proposes a novel sampling-based planning framework for autonomous photography that incorporates a new evaluation metric to enhance image quality and minimize the number of photos needed.

A Schwarz-Christoffel Mapping-based Framework for Sim-to-Real Transfer in Autonomous Robot Operations; This work proposes a lightweight Schwarz-Christoffel Mapping (SCM) framework to close the sim-to-real gap by geometrically mapping control and planning policies from an expert teacher to a degraded learner.

Toward Robotic Triage: a Distributed Task and Motion Planning Framework for Efficient Human-Robot Emergency Response; This paper proposes a distributed task and motion planning (TAMP) framework for human-robot emergency response, where a heterogeneous robotic system coordinates with a medic to efficiently find and assist victims.

Genetic and clinical heterogeneity in eIF2B-related disorder; This paper reports 9 novel mutations in the EIF2B genes, which cause a heritable white matter disorder, and uses homology modeling to analyze their impact on the eIF2B protein complex.

Nature and etiology of hollow-organ abdominal injuries in frontal crashes; This study investigates the risk factors and potential mechanisms of hollow-organ abdominal injuries in belted occupants during frontal automobile collisions by analyzing field survey data.

Inherited disorders of GABA metabolism; This article reviews the inherited disorders of GABA metabolism, including GABA-transaminase deficiency and succinic semialdehyde dehydrogenase (SSADH) deficiency, highlighting their clinical phenotypes and diagnostic methods.

Effectiveness of barrier devices, high-volume evacuators, and extraoral suction devices on reducing dental aerosols for the dental operator: A pilot study; This pilot study measured aerosolized particles in the breathing zone of dental operators, finding that a microscope and drape provided the lowest levels of aerosols compared to loupes with or without a face shield.

Diagnosis and treatment of neurotransmitter disorders; This article reviews the diagnosis and treatment of neurotransmitter disorders, covering disorders of monoamine synthesis, glycine catabolism, pyridoxine dependency, and GABA metabolism, and emphasizes the importance of CSF analysis.

Injury patterns and seat belt effectiveness in pregnant motor vehicle occupants: evidence from US crash data, 1998–2021; This study analyzes US crash data from 1998-2021 to evaluate seat belt effectiveness in preventing injuries to pregnant motor vehicle occupants and investigates modifying vehicle- and occupant-specific factors.

Relationship with sex-based anatomical differences to lower extremity injury severity in frontal crashes; This study investigates whether sex-based anatomical differences, measured on CT scans, contribute to the increased risk of lower extremity injuries for females in frontal car crashes.

Congruency of crash-and hospital-reported injuries among child passengers; This study compares crash scene and hospital-reported injury information for child passengers in New Jersey, exploring the congruency of injury frequency, severity, and location by age and restraint type.

Intact window glass predicts low risk of serious injury in pediatric patients after a motor vehicle collision; This retrospective cohort study using NASS-CDS data finds that intact window glazings in a vehicle after a collision predict a low risk of moderate or greater severity injury in pediatric occupants.

Comparison of deep learning approaches to estimate injury severity from the International Classification of Diseases codes; This study compares the performance of feed-forward neural networks (FFNN) and neural machine translation (NMT) models for estimating injury severity from ICD codes, finding that NMT is more accurate.

On-the-fly machine-learning for high-throughput experiments: search for rare-earth-free permanent magnets; This paper demonstrates an on-the-fly machine learning approach using mean shift theory to rapidly analyze high-throughput diffraction data and delineate structural evolution in the search for rare-earth-free permanent magnets.

Architecture and magnetism of alnico; This work uses atom probe tomography to show that the nanostructure and coercivity of alnico permanent magnets are sensitive to alloying elements and the crystallographic orientation during spinodal decomposition.

Competing Magnetic Interactions in the Antiferromagnetic Topological Insulator; This inelastic neutron scattering study of the antiferromagnetic topological insulator MnBi2Te4 reveals long-ranged and frustrated magnetic interactions, suggesting proximity to various magnetic phases.

Exploring the structural complexity of intermetallic compounds by an adaptive genetic algorithm; This paper demonstrates an adaptive genetic algorithm to predict and solve the complex crystal structures of intermetallic compounds, identifying the hard magnetic phase and origin of high coercivity in Sm2Co17.

Defect-driven ferrimagnetism and hidden magnetization in; This study uses high-field magnetization measurements to show that the magnetization of MnBi2Te4 and MnSb2Te4 occurs in stages, with the low-field state consisting of ferrimagnetic blocks with both uniform and staggered components.

Three-dimensional nature of anomalous Hall conductivity in YMn6Sn6−xGax, x ≈ 0.55; This study of the ferrimagnetic kagome metal YMn6Sn5.45Ga0.55 finds that its intrinsic anomalous Hall effect is three-dimensional, demonstrating that the Hall response does not originate from 2D Chern gaps.

Giant coercivity and enhanced intrinsic anomalous Hall effect at vanishing magnetization in a compensated kagome ferrimagnet; This study demonstrates that doping the kagome ferrimagnet TbMn6Sn6 with Cr drives it toward magnetic compensation, resulting in giant coercive fields and an enhanced intrinsic anomalous Hall effect.

Accurate calculation of light rare-earth magnetic anisotropy with density functional theory; This paper proposes an efficient DFT-based method that combines constrained DFT+U with crystal field theory to accurately calculate the magnetic anisotropy energy of light rare-earth magnets like SmCo5.

Importance of enforcing Hund’s rules in density functional theory calculations of rare earth magnetocrystalline anisotropy; This paper shows how enforcing Hund’s rules in density functional theory calculations can mitigate self-interaction errors and improve the accuracy of magnetocrystalline anisotropy predictions for rare-earth materials.

Oscillating Grain Boundaries and Their Effects on Grain Growth: Observations in Skyrmion Bicrystals; This study shows that in 2D skyrmion bicrystals, grain boundaries can undergo large amplitude oscillations driven by particle motion, a behavior not accounted for in traditional models of grain growth.

Cell-specific targeting of nanoparticles by multivalent attachment of small molecules; This paper describes the parallel synthesis and screening of a library of 146 nanoparticles decorated with small molecules, discovering a series with high specificity for endothelial, macrophage, or pancreatic cancer cells.

Noninvasive vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 imaging identifies inflammatory activation of cells in atherosclerosis; This study develops a novel, second-generation VCAM-1-targeted nanoparticle imaging agent with enhanced affinity that enables real-time detection of inflammatory activation in atherosclerosis.

Detection of vascular adhesion molecule-1 expression using a novel multimodal nanoparticle; This study develops a novel VCAM-1–targeted multimodal nanoparticle that uses phage display–derived internalizing peptides to chaperone and trap imaging agents inside VCAM-1–expressing cells.

Early detection of sporadic pancreatic cancer: summative review; This summative review analyzes the current efforts, gaps, and challenges in the early detection of sporadic pancreatic cancer, outlining a collaborative strategic pathway for the future of the field.

Plectin-1 as a novel biomarker for pancreatic cancer; This study validates plectin-1 (Plec1) as a novel and specific biomarker for pancreatic cancer, showing its expression increases during carcinogenesis and its usability as an imaging target in a murine model.

Abstract P2-02-17: Race and outcomes in HR+/HER2-breast cancer: how tissue morphology and molecular pathways contribute to worse outcomes in Black women; This study conducts an in-depth analysis of tissue morphology and molecular pathways in Black and White women with early-stage HR+ breast cancer to elucidate the biological factors driving outcome disparities.

An integrative analysis of circulating and tumor microenvironment (TME) determinants of patient response in the Checkmate 9ER (CM 9ER) trial of nivolumab and cabozantinib …; This study investigates how the tumor microenvironment and circulating factors are associated with response to nivolumab and cabozantinib in advanced renal cell carcinoma patients from the Checkmate 9ER trial.

Imaging Cell Surface Plectin in PDAC Patients–A First-In-Human Phase 0 Study Report; This first-in-human phase 0 study evaluates the ability of the radiolabeled peptide PTP-01 to target cell surface plectin (CSP) in pancreatic tumors, despite their dense desmoplastic stroma.

Plectin as a novel therapeutic target for pancreatic cancer; This article reviews the discovery and validation of cell surface plectin (CSP) as a novel therapeutic target for pancreatic cancer, highlighting its role in proliferation, migration, and invasion.
Cancer specific plectin-1 specific antibodies and methods of use thereof

Targeting adenovirus to the serotype 3 receptor increases gene transfer efficiency to ovarian cancer cells; This study constructs an Ad5-based vector with a chimeric Ad3 knob to retarget gene delivery to the Ad3 receptor, circumventing CAR deficiency and increasing gene transfer efficiency to ovarian cancer cells.

Adenoviral gene therapy for cancer: from vectors to targeted and replication competent agents; This review discusses adenoviral gene therapy for cancer, covering strategies like mutation compensation and replication-competent agents, and developments in tumor-specific targeting and infectivity enhancement.

Transcriptional targeting of tumors with a novel tumor-specific survivin promoter; This study demonstrates that a recombinant adenoviral vector using the tumor-specific survivin promoter can drive high levels of reporter gene expression in multiple tumor cell lines and primary melanoma cells.

The secretory leukoprotease inhibitor (SLPI) promoter for ovarian cancer gene therapy; This study evaluates the use of the secretory leukoprotease inhibitor (SLPI) promoter in an adenoviral vector to achieve selective transgene expression in ovarian cancer cells both in vitro and in vivo.

Viral-based modelling and correction of neurodegenerative diseases by RNA interference; This article discusses the use of viral-based RNA interference (RNAi) as a platform to model and correct both recessive and dominant human genetic neurodegenerative diseases in a broad range of animal models.

The use of healthcare disparities as a tool to teach BME undergraduates about the importance of social justice in biomedical design.; This paper discusses using healthcare disparities as a tool to teach BME undergraduates about the importance of social justice, empathy, and other non-technical proficiencies in biomedical design.

A introductory-level, student-taught biomedical neuroengineering course for 1st year undeclared engineering undergraduate students; This paper describes an introductory-level, student-taught biomedical neuroengineering course designed to expose first-year undeclared engineering students to the applications, research, and career opportunities in the field.

Teaching engineering design through a team-based multi-disciplinary humanitarian engineering project: effects on engineering identity and sense of belonging; This paper describes a team-based, multi-disciplinary humanitarian engineering project designed to teach engineering design and address real-world challenges by incorporating technical, social, and cultural issues.

Creating Inclusive Classrooms: Work Developed during the ASEE Year of Impact on Racial Equity (YIRE); This paper describes the work of an ASEE subcommittee that developed tenets for creating inclusive classrooms that actively incorporate antiracist pedagogy as part of the Year of Impact on Racial Equity.

A historical context of municipal solid waste management in the United States; This paper provides a historical context of municipal solid waste management (MSWM) in the United States, tracing its evolution from the lack of organized public works in the 1800s to the development of modern systems.

What do science, technology, and innovation mean from Africa?; This collection of essays questions contemporary, Western-centric definitions of science, technology, and innovation (STI) by exploring what these concepts might mean from an African perspective.

Capacity factor analysis for evaluating water and sanitation infrastructure choices for developing communities; This paper presents the capacity factor analysis (CFA) model, a tool for assessing a community's capacity to manage and sustain access to water supply and sanitation (Watsan) infrastructure in developing countries.

Integrating ethics & engineering: A graduate option in systems engineering, ethics, and technology studies; This paper describes a graduate option in Systems Engineering that integrates technical and ethical training through the use of realistic case studies to foster reflection on the moral implications of technology.

A decision model for selecting sustainable drinking water supply and greywater reuse systems for developing communities with a case study in Cimahi, Indonesia; This research develops a decision model using Capacity Factor Analysis to help select sustainable drinking water supply and greywater reuse systems for developing communities, with a case study in Indonesia.

Addressing social equity in coastal climate adaptation planning: A case study of Norfolk, Virginia; This research uses stakeholder interviews in Norfolk, Virginia, to characterize how social equity is being integrated into coastal climate adaptation planning to address environmental justice and historical disparities.

Portfolio Agriculture: A Model for Resilient Regional Agricultural Planning; This research proposes a regional portfolio agriculture model to identify crop choices and compositions that align with microclimate variations, enabling farmers to assess tradeoffs between financial returns and production risks.

Ethics Case Study Project: Broadening STEM Participation by Normalizing Immersion of Diverse Groups in Peer to Near Peer Collaborations; This paper discusses a team-based Ethics case study project that brings together diverse high school, HBCU, and PWI students to normalize immersion in STEM and build self-efficacy through peer-to-near-peer collaborations.

Optimal control strategies for water, sanitation, and hygiene in mitigating spread of waterborne diseases; This study formulates and analyzes a mathematical model using optimal control theory to find the right balance of water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) interventions to mitigate the spread of waterborne diseases.

Harnessing the Power of Convolutional Neural Networks for Algal Blooms Forecasting; This paper explores the use of Convolutional Neural Networks as a promising deep learning alternative to complex mechanistic models for providing accurate and timely forecasts of algal blooms.

Strategic online advertising: Modeling Internet user behavior with Advertising. com; This study investigates how to improve online advertising efficacy by modeling user behavior to predict advertising response and probabilistically serving ads based on those behaviors.

Extending the Markowitz model with dimensionality reduction: Forecasting efficient frontiers; This paper proposes an extension to the Markowitz model that uses dimensionality reduction to forecast efficient frontiers, accounting for the nonstationary behavior of asset returns and covariances.

A Fundamental Misunderstanding of Risk: The Bias Associated with the Annualized Calculation of Standard Deviation; This article revisits the discussion on the annualized calculation of standard deviation in finance, presenting a new example that illustrates the inherent bias in this common risk measurement practice.

Are financial market states recurrent and persistent?; This article proposes an innovative approach to segmenting financial market time periods into discrete, persistent, and recurrent states to formalize and evaluate state-based decision-making models.

The Current State and Future Needs of Systems Engineering Education: A Proposed Curriculum *; This paper examines the current and future state of systems engineering education, identifying evolving industry demands and proposing a curriculum that better aligns with these needs.

Portfolio design and management through state-based analytics: A probabilistic approach; This paper presents an innovative, state-based approach to investment portfolio design that uses a Markovian process and optimization to make asset allocation decisions based on market state membership.

Novel carbon nanotube− polystyrene foam composites for electromagnetic interference shielding; This paper reports the fabrication of a novel, lightweight carbon nanotube-polystyrene foam composite that demonstrates very effective electromagnetic interference (EMI) shielding properties.

Conductive carbon nanofiber–polymer foam structures; This study develops conductive carbon-nanofiber-filled polymer-foam structures, targeting their use for lightweight and effective electromagnetic interference (EMI) shielding applications.

The handbook of photonics; This second edition of The Handbook of Photonics explores recent advances in the field, covering photonics materials, devices, and systems, with new sections on optical fiber technology, nanotechnology, and polymeric optical materials.

Self-organized micro/nano structures in metal surfaces by ultrafast laser irradiation; This study investigates the formation of self-organized conical micro/nano structures on various metal surfaces by ultrafast laser irradiation, exploring the influence of laser parameters and gaseous environments.

A comparative study of EMI shielding properties of carbon nanofiber and multi-walled carbon nanotube filled polymer composites; This comparative study investigates the electromagnetic interference (EMI) shielding properties of carbon nanofiber- and multi-walled carbon nanotube-filled polystyrene composites, finding that carbon nanotubes are more effective at low filler loadings.

A High Spatial and Depth Resolution Deep-UV 266 nm Wavelength Laser-Based Integrated LIBS, Fluorescence, and Raman System for Probing Lunar and Planetary Simulants and …; This paper describes a high-resolution, deep-UV 266 nm laser-based integrated LIBS, fluorescence, and Raman (LFR) system developed for probing lunar and planetary simulants and geological materials.

Mixture Detection Using a Deep-UV Raman-LIBS Autofocus-Based Compact Chemical Spectroscopic Sensor; This paper presents a compact, handheld chemical sensor that integrates deep-UV Raman and laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) using a single 266 nm laser and an autofocus mechanism for mixture detection.
Laser fabrication of lead selenide thin film

Gold Metal Recovery from Electronic Waste through Laser Generation of Micro and Nanoparticles; This study presents the first demonstration of using laser ablation to recover gold from electronic waste in the form of micro- and high-value nanoparticles, identifying the ablation threshold with a two-temperature model.

Laser Recycling of Silver in Bulk and nanoparticle Form from Silicon Solar Cells and Deep Learning for Process Automation; This study advances the green recycling of silver from silicon solar cells by using laser ablation to selectively remove and recover it as microparticles and nanoparticles, with a CNN model for process automation.

Ultra-fast germanium photodiode with 3-dB bandwidth of 265 GHz; This paper demonstrates a waveguide-coupled germanium photodiode on a scalable silicon platform with an optoelectrical 3-dB bandwidth of 265 GHz, surpassing the performance of state-of-the-art III-V devices.

High-saturation-current modified uni-traveling-carrier photodiode with cliff layer; This paper demonstrates two modified uni-traveling carrier photodiode (MUTC) structures that incorporate a "cliff" layer to achieve high saturation current, reaching a bandwidth product of 3456 GHz·mA.

High-power, high-linearity photodiodes; This paper reviews the performance of high-power, high-linearity modified uni-traveling carrier photodiodes, which are key components for microwave photonics and optics-based analog links.

Integrated optical frequency division for microwave and mmWave generation; This paper demonstrates a miniaturized, chip-based optical frequency division system that uses soliton microcombs to generate ultra-low-noise microwave and mmWave signals on an integrated photonic platform.

Integrated lithium niobate photonic computing circuit based on efficient and high-speed electro-optic conversion; This paper demonstrates a thin-film lithium niobate (TFLN) photonic computing circuit that leverages efficient electro-optic conversion and spatial scalability to perform inference tasks with high speed and low energy consumption.

Universal electronic synthesis by microresonator-soliton photomixing; This paper describes a chip-scale, universal millimeter-wave frequency synthesizer that uses dual, microresonator-soliton frequency combs and high-speed photodetection to generate tunable electronic signals from DC to >1000 GHz.

Community-based game design: experiments on social games for commonsense data collection; This research explores how to design sustainable and high-quality human computation games for commonsense data collection by implementing and analyzing two social games on Facebook and PTT.

Mmtom-qa: Multimodal theory of mind question answering; This paper introduces MMToM-QA, a new multimodal benchmark for evaluating machine Theory of Mind, and proposes BIP-ALM, a novel method that uses Bayesian inverse planning accelerated by language models to engineer this capacity.

Encoding formulas as deep networks: Reinforcement learning for zero-shot execution of LTL formulas; This paper demonstrates a reinforcement learning agent with a compositional recurrent neural network that can perform zero-shot generalization to satisfy previously unseen LTL formulas in both symbolic and Minecraft-like domains.

Learning a natural-language to LTL executable semantic parser for grounded robotics; This paper presents a grounded semantic parser that learns to translate natural language commands into executable Linear Temporal Logic (LTL) formulas for robotic execution without direct annotation or correction.

Reconstructing action-conditioned human-object interactions using commonsense knowledge priors; This paper presents a method for inferring diverse 3D models of human-object interactions from single 2D images by using action-conditioned modeling and commonsense knowledge priors extracted from large language models.

Class: Contrastive learning via action sequence supervision for robot manipulation; This paper introduces CLASS, a method for learning behavioral representations for robot manipulation from heterogeneous demonstration data using supervised contrastive learning with weak supervision from similar action sequences.

OAfford: One-Shot 3D Object-to-Object Affordance Grounding for Generalizable Robotic Manipulation; This paper proposes OAfford, a novel one-shot 3D object-to-object affordance grounding approach for robotic manipulation that combines vision foundation models and point clouds for effective generalization.

Moving Out: Physically-grounded Human-AI Collaboration; This paper introduces Moving Out, a new physically-grounded human-AI collaboration benchmark, and BASS, a novel method to enhance agent diversity and understanding for complex collaborative tasks.

Towards Physically-grounded Human-AI Collaboration; This paper introduces Moving Out, a new physical human-AI collaboration environment designed to illustrate challenges in coordination, awareness, and action consistency, highlighting the failure of existing AI agents in these areas.

CaseEdit: Enhancing Localized Commonsense Reasoning via Null-Space Constrained Knowledge Editing in Small Parameter Language Models; This paper introduces CaseEdit, a new dataset and pipeline for evaluating localized commonsense knowledge editing in small LLMs, and shows that null-space constrained methods like AlphaEdit are highly effective.

Generative models for molecular discovery: Recent advances and challenges; This review covers recent advances in generative molecular design, discussing model design choices, problem formulations for inverse design, and considerations for integrating these models into real discovery campaigns.

Autonomous, multiproperty-driven molecular discovery: From predictions to measurements and back; This paper describes a closed-loop, autonomous molecular discovery platform that integrates machine learning to experimentally realize 294 unreported dye-like molecules across three automated design-make-test-analyze cycles.

Predicting small molecule transfer free energies by combining molecular dynamics simulations and deep learning; This paper presents a large dataset of 15,000 small molecule transfer free energies from water to cyclohexane, calculated using molecular dynamics, and uses it to train a deep learning model for predicting hydrophobicity.

Toward in silico CMC: An industrial collaborative approach to model‐based process development; This manuscript summarizes the proceedings of the Third Modeling Workshop on bioprocess modeling, discussing the current state and future directions of modeling from the molecular to the facility scale.

Machine learning for predicting the viscosity of binary liquid mixtures; This work develops a graph-based neural network architecture and an automated data curation pipeline to predict the viscosity of binary liquid mixtures as a function of composition and temperature.

The Future of Artificial Intelligence and the Mathematical and Physical Sciences (AI+ MPS); This community paper, developed from an NSF workshop, summarizes the MPS community's perspective on how to best capitalize on and contribute to the future of Artificial Intelligence in the mathematical and physical sciences.

Energy-Based Models for Predicting Mutational Effects on Proteins; This work proposes a new energy-based model approach for predicting changes in protein binding free energy (ΔΔG) by decomposing it into sequence-based and structure-based components.

Deep Interactions for Multimodal Molecular Property Prediction; This work proposes MolInteract, a simple and effective architecture-focused approach for multimodal molecular property prediction that uses an interaction layer to fuse 2D and 3D information.

CAREER: Peptide-Functionalized Surfaces for Designing Tunable Nanoscale Patterns; This CAREER award supports research to design peptide-functionalized surfaces with tunable nanoscale patterns by understanding how molecules change their behavior when tethered to a surface.

PepMNet: a hybrid deep learning model for predicting peptide properties using hierarchical graph representations; This paper develops PepMNet, a hybrid deep learning model that uses a hierarchical graph approach to integrate atom-level and amino acid-level information for predicting peptide properties.

Electron-phonon coupling and electron heat capacity of metals under conditions of strong electron-phonon nonequilibrium; This computational analysis investigates the dependence of electron-phonon coupling and electron heat capacity on electron temperature for eight metals under strong electron-phonon nonequilibrium conditions.

Combined atomistic-continuum modeling of short-pulse laser melting and disintegration of metal films; This study uses a coupled atomistic-continuum model to investigate the kinetics and mechanisms of short-pulse laser melting and disintegration of thin metal films, revealing an interplay between melting front propagation and homogeneous nucleation.

Atomistic modeling of short pulse laser ablation of metals: connections between melting, spallation, and phase explosion; This study uses a combined molecular dynamics and continuum model to investigate short-pulse laser ablation of metals, identifying three regimes of material response: melting, photomechanical spallation, and phase explosion.

Microscopic mechanisms of laser ablation of organic solids in the thermal and stress confinement irradiation regimes; This large-scale molecular dynamics study demonstrates that the mechanisms of laser ablation of organic solids strongly depend on the irradiation regime, with phase explosion dominating in the thermal confinement regime and spallation in the stress confinement regime.

Effects of temperature and disorder on thermal boundary conductance at solid–solid interfaces: Nonequilibrium molecular dynamics simulations; This study develops a nonequilibrium molecular dynamics (NEMD) approach to investigate thermal boundary conductance at solid-solid interfaces, finding a significant temperature dependence not accounted for by mismatch models.

Effects of material density and structural anisotropy on thermal transport in carbon nanotube materials; This large-scale mesoscopic simulation study finds that the thermal conductivity of carbon nanotube (CNT) aerogels, films, and fibers follows a nearly linear scaling law with respect to material density.

Time-resolved probing and modeling of optical signatures of ultrashort-pulse laser spallation and phase explosion in iron-nickel targets; This integrated computational and experimental study establishes direct links between the dynamics of laser ablation of FeNi targets and the evolution of optical signals in pump-probe measurements, covering both spallation and phase explosion regimes.

Dynamics of nanoscale phase decomposition in laser ablation; This study combines time-resolved X-ray probing with large-scale atomistic modeling to gain unique insights into the ablation dynamics of thin gold films, mapping nanoscale density heterogeneities to distinct diffraction features.

Thermal conductivity of three-dimensional disordered isotropic fibrous materials; This study numerically and theoretically investigates the thermal conductivity of three-dimensional disordered isotropic fibrous materials, deriving a theoretical equation for dense networks and a universal power law near the percolation threshold.

Atomistic modelling of femtosecond laser melting of Pb nanoparticles embedded in Al film; This molecular dynamics study investigates the femtosecond laser melting of a Pb nanoparticle embedded in an Al film, revealing that melting is driven by homogeneous nucleation within the superheated nanoparticle.

Estimating static models of strategic interactions; This paper studies the estimation of static games of incomplete information with multiple equilibria, proposing a flexible estimator and an algorithm for simulating all equilibria, with an application to stock recommendations.

Machine learning methods for demand estimation; This paper surveys and applies several statistical and machine learning techniques to the problem of demand estimation, proposing a robust and scalable method for combining underlying models via linear regression.

Nonlinear models of measurement errors; This article provides an overview of recent research on estimation methods for nonlinear models with both classical and nonclassical measurement errors, describing key ideas for identification and estimation.
A structural model of sponsored search advertising auctions

Econometrics for learning agents; This paper develops a theory of inference for player valuations in generalized second-price auctions, relying on the weaker assumption of no-regret learning rather than the traditional Nash equilibrium assumption.
Suggested searches

Statistical inference of optimal allocations I: Regularities and their implications; This paper develops a functional differentiability approach for solving statistical optimal allocation problems, deriving Hadamard differentiability of the value functions and applying the functional delta method to obtain their asymptotic properties.

The key role of absolute risk in the disclosure risk assessment of public data releases; This article argues for the key role of absolute disclosure risk in the privacy risk assessment of public data releases, countering arguments that favor differential privacy.

Human vs. generative AI in content creation competition: symbiosis or conflict?; This work introduces a competition model generalized from the Tullock contest to analyze the tension between human creators and generative AI, suggesting that a stable equilibrium between human and AI-generated content is possible.

The econometrics of static and dynamic models of strategic interactions; This chapter reviews the econometric analysis of static and dynamic models of strategic interactions, focusing on identification and estimation methods for recovering structural parameters and making counter-factual policy forecasts.

Numerical approaches for motion of dispersed particles, droplets and bubbles; This paper reviews recent computational approaches for the two-phase flow motion of dispersed particles, droplets, and bubbles, focusing on momentum transfer and turbulent diffusion in dilute systems.

Recent advances in the mechanical durability of superhydrophobic materials; This review covers advances since 2011 in the fabrication, design, and understanding of mechanically durable superhydrophobic surfaces, summarizing progress on improving resistance against various types of wear damage.

Drag of non-spherical solid particles of regular and irregular shape; This paper reviews and investigates the drag of non-spherical particles of regular and irregular shapes, developing a modified Clift-Gauvin expression that integrates the Stokes and Newton regimes.

Inherently superoleophobic nanocomposite coatings by spray atomization; This paper describes a technique to fabricate inherently superoleophobic coatings by spray casting a self-assembling nanocomposite slurry of ZnO nanoparticles and a perfluoroacrylic polymer.

Quasi-steady shape and drag of deformable bubbles and drops; This paper reviews and develops new descriptions for the quasi-steady shape and drag coefficient of isolated deformable drops and bubbles, formulated in terms of local Weber and Reynolds numbers.

Spray-based Near-Isothermal Compression and Expansion for an Offshore Wind Energy Storage System; This study explores a novel Turbine-Integrated Isothermal Compressed Air Energy Storage (TICAES) concept for offshore wind, using a spray-based numerical model to assess the performance of near-isothermal compression and expansion.

Effects of freestream turbulence on energy harvesting of a single semi-passive oscillating hydrofoil; This experimental study investigates the impact of freestream turbulence on the energy harvesting performance of a single semi-passive oscillating hydrofoil turbine, a potential renewable energy device for rivers.
Icing on Compressors and Fans

Substructure Optimization for a Semi-Submersible Floating Wind Turbine Under Extreme Environmental Conditions; This study uses a stepped optimization scheme with OpenFAST to minimize the levelized cost of energy for a semi-submersible floating wind turbine by optimizing its substructure under extreme environmental conditions.

Experimental characterization of an axisymmetric-sector inertial particle separator wind tunnel; This paper describes the construction and characterization of a novel, vertically oriented, axisymmetric-sector Inertial Particle Separator (IPS) wind tunnel designed to preserve realistic flow features for studying particle separation.

High strength and ductility of additively manufactured 316L stainless steel explained; This study explores the structure-property relationships of additively manufactured 316L stainless steel, explaining its high strength and ductility through the presence of a fine cellular-dendritic substructure and high dislocation density.

A novel laser transfer process for direct writing of electronic and sensor materials; This paper introduces MAPLE direct write (MAPLE DW), a new laser-based direct-write technique that combines LIFT and MAPLE to transfer and deposit electronic and sensor materials in air at room temperature.

New approach to laser direct writing active and passive mesoscopic circuit elements; This paper describes MAPLE DW (matrix-assisted pulsed laser evaporation direct write), a novel laser-driven technique for the direct writing of active and passive mesoscopic circuit elements like resistors and capacitors.

Pulsed laser deposition vs. matrix assisted pulsed laser evaporation for growth of biodegradable polymer thin films; This study compares conventional pulsed laser deposition (PLD) and matrix-assisted pulsed laser evaporation (MAPLE) for depositing thin films of the biodegradable polymer PLGA, finding significant molecular weight changes in both techniques.

Engineered interfaces for adherent diamond coatings on large thermal-expansion coefficient mismatched substrates; This paper reports a method to increase the adherence of diamond coatings on substrates with large thermal-expansion mismatches by creating a three-dimensional, thermally and compositionally graded interface.

Utilizing Strain Rate Jump Testing to Predict Incremental Spin Formability of Al Alloys Sensitive to Portevin–Le Chatelier Instabilities; This study utilizes strain rate jump testing to predict the incremental spin formability of Al alloys, investigating the effects of rapid strain rate changes on Portevin–Le Chatelier (PLC) instabilities and formability metrics.

Thermophysical modeling of niobium alloys informs materials selection and design for high-temperature applications; This paper reviews and provides new thermophysical property data for several Nb-alloys, using physics-based models to compare their high-temperature performance with Ni-superalloys and other refractory alloys.

A unified model of tensile and creep deformation for use in niobium alloy materials selection and design for high-temperature applications; This study reviews the high-temperature constitutive responses of Nb-alloys and proposes a unified model combining the Larson-Miller parameter and Sellars-Tegart model to describe both tensile and creep deformation.

Utilizing Strain Rate Jump Testing to Predict Flow Formability of Al Alloys Sensitive to Portevin-Le Chatelier Instabilities; This work investigates the use of strain rate jump testing to predict the flow formability of Al alloys, focusing on how rapid changes in strain rate affect Portevin-Le Chatelier (PLC) instabilities.

Software reflexion models: Bridging the gap between source and high-level models; This paper presents software reflexion models, a technique that helps engineers compare a high-level model of a software system with its source code to see where the models agree and differ.

Ultra-large-scale systems: The software challenge of the future; This report outlines the future software challenge of ultra-large-scale (ULS) systems, which will be decentralized, continuously evolving, and constructed from heterogeneous parts, requiring new software engineering practices.

Managing technical debt in software-reliant systems; This paper argues for managing technical debt in software-reliant systems by developing economic models to understand and communicate the long-term effects of short-term expedients.

Software reflexion models: Bridging the gap between design and implementation; This paper presents software reflexion models, a technique that allows engineers to compare design and implementation artifacts by summarizing their consistencies and inconsistencies, supporting tasks like design conformance and change assessment.

The structure and value of modularity in software design; This paper evaluates the potential of a new theory, which uses design structure matrices and real options, to inform software design by applying it to Parnas's classic KWIC designs.

Realism Constructs for ADS Simulation Testing; This paper addresses the simulation-reality gap in validating Automated Driving Systems (ADSs) by proposing realism constructs to assure the construct validity of simulation-based testing methods.
Systems and methods for data warehousing

Semantic image fuzzing of AI perception systems; This paper introduces semSensFuzz, a new fuzz testing approach for AI perception systems that uses semantic mutation of real-world test cases to efficiently reveal misinterpretations.

Fuzzing mobile robot environments for fast automated crash detection; This work explores fuzzing as an automated test input generation technique for mobile robots, developing PHYS-FUZZ, which accounts for physical attributes to more quickly find failure-inducing scenarios.
Ultra Large Scale (ULS) Systems

Improving network management with software defined networking; This paper discusses how Software Defined Networking (SDN), by separating the data and control planes, can improve network management by allowing a centralized software program to control network behavior.

Procera: A language for high-level reactive network control; This paper describes Procera, a control architecture for software-defined networking (SDN) that includes a declarative policy language based on functional reactive programming to express dynamic, stateful network policies.

Kinetic: Verifiable Dynamic Network Control; This paper presents Kinetic, a domain-specific language and control system that allows network operators to control their networks dynamically and automatically verifies the correctness of these control programs.

Coronet: Fault tolerance for software defined networks; This paper presents CORONET, a fault-tolerant Software Defined Networking (SDN) architecture that can rapidly recover from multiple link failures in the data plane.

The evolution of network configuration: A tale of two campuses; This study examines and analyzes five years of router, switch, and firewall configurations from two large campus networks to understand how network configuration evolves over time.

Scalable Video Conferencing Using SDN Principles; This paper presents Scallop, an SDN-inspired selective forwarding unit (SFU) for video conferencing that decouples media operations into a hardware data plane and a software control plane for improved scalability.

Spotlight: Shining a Light on Pivot Attacks Using In-network Computing; This paper presents Spotlight, a P4-based system that leverages a programmable data plane to detect pivot attacks by analyzing traffic patterns without relying on end hosts or middleboxes.

Automating Distributed In-network Classification with Runtime Programmability; This paper presents ACORN, a distributed system that automatically translates user-level Python machine learning programs into network-level programs and deploys them with runtime programmability for in-network classification.

Nap: Programming data planes with approximate data structures; This paper proposes NAP, a high-level network programming language with a versatile approximate dictionary abstraction that allows programmers to easily use compact data structures on programmable data planes.

Hydra: Effective runtime network verification; This paper presents Hydra, a system that uses runtime verification to check that every packet in a network is correctly processed by compiling properties written in a domain-specific language into executable P4 code.

Chemically Exfoliated MoS2 as Near‐Infrared Photothermal Agents; This paper reports the use of chemically exfoliated MoS2 nanosheets as effective near-infrared (NIR) photothermal agents for applications like tissue ablation and drug release.

Phase stability and mechanical properties of novel high entropy transition metal carbides; This study synthesizes and characterizes twelve different equiatomic five-metal high entropy carbides, finding that nine form true single-phase materials with significantly enhanced hardness.

High-entropy fluorite oxides; This study fabricates and characterizes eleven high-entropy fluorite oxides with five principal cations, finding that eight possess single-phase solid solutions with high configurational entropies and can be sintered to high density.

Crossover from incoherent to coherent phonon scattering in epitaxial oxide superlattices; This paper presents an unambiguous demonstration of the crossover from diffuse (particle-like) to specular (wave-like) phonon scattering in epitaxial oxide superlattices, manifested as a minimum in thermal conductivity.

Reduction in the thermal conductivity of single crystalline silicon by phononic crystal patterning; This study measures the cross-plane thermal conductivity of single crystalline silicon phononic crystals, finding values over an order of magnitude lower than bulk Si, indicating that coherent phononic effects are responsible.

Interfacial thermal transport via plasmon polaritons in a hyperbolic metamaterial; This study uses an ultrafast pump-probe technique to measure near-field heat transfer across metamaterial interfaces, demonstrating the thermal excitation of hyperbolic plasmon-polaritons in a CdO-based hyperbolic metamaterial.

In-plane thermal conductivity and the applicability of the Wiedemann–Franz law in dilute AlCu thin films; This study performs independent measurements of the in-plane thermal and electrical conductivities of dilute AlCu thin films, finding that the Wiedemann–Franz law overpredicts the thermal conductivity by at least ~10%.

Topology-Driven Vibrations in a Chiral Polar Vortex Lattice; This study uses momentum-resolved electron energy-loss spectroscopy to demonstrate that polar vortex lattices in PbTiO3 spatially modulate the material's vibrational spectrum, with the vortex chirality imparting a unique asymmetrical spectral shift.

Characterisation by phase mappings of microstructural-thermal-mechanical properties in equimolar refractory high-entropy alloys with reduced neutron cross-section; This study screens over fifteen million refractory high-entropy alloy combinations to select candidates with low neutron absorption and then characterizes the microstructural, thermal, and mechanical properties of three promising alloys.

Time-domain thermoreflectance; This Primer describes the theory, design, and implementation of time-domain thermoreflectance (TDTR), a pump-probe metrology instrumental for measuring the heat transfer properties of bulk and nanostructured materials.

Merkel cells are essential for light-touch responses; This study uses conditional deletion of the transcription factor Atoh1 to show that Merkel cells are essential for the proper encoding of light-touch responses mediated by Merkel cell-neurite complexes.

Distinction of self-produced touch and social touch at cortical and spinal cord levels; This study uses fMRI, behavioral testing, and somatosensory-evoked potentials to investigate the neural mechanisms underlying the distinction between self-produced touch and touch by others.

Providing a sense of touch to prosthetic hands; This article reviews the latest innovations in providing sensory feedback to prosthetic hands, arguing in favor of peripheral nerve interfaces to restore functionality and reduce cognitive burden.

The regularity of sustained firing reveals two populations of slowly adapting touch receptors in mouse hairy skin; This study uses an ex vivo skin-nerve preparation and model-based cluster analysis to show that the regularity of sustained firing can distinguish slowly adapting type I (SAI) and type II (SAII) touch receptors in mouse skin.

The effect of fingertip microstructures on tactile edge perception; This work uses finite element models to show that the microstructure of fingertip ridges produces high, local stress concentrations at ridge tips, enhancing the contrast of stress signals for tactile edge perception.

Strain-based biomarkers at the skin surface detect changes in soft tissue mobility linked to myofascial pain following soft tissue manipulation intervention; This study uses digital image correlation to capture skin surface deformation during soft tissue manipulation, demonstrating that strain-based biomarkers can objectively measure increases in tissue mobility and align with self-reported pain.

Capturing 3D Skin Deformation and Finger Kinematics in Active Touch with Compliant Materials; This work describes a novel approach using digital image correlation to measure 3D cutaneous skin deformation and kinesthetic digit movements during active touch exploration of compliant materials.

Evaluating the Importance of Demographic and Technical Factors in Creating Authentic-Sounding AI-Generated Human Voice Clones; This study investigates the demographic and technical factors that lead to more authentic-sounding AI-generated human voice clones by evaluating a library of cloned and authentic voices with human listeners.

3-D Reconstruction of Fingertip Deformation during Contact Initiation; This study uses 3-D digital image correlation (DIC) to reconstruct and analyze the spatiotemporal evolution of fingertip skin deformation during contact initiation, revealing rapid deformation and high compliance at low forces.

Strain-based biomarkers at the skin surface differentiate asymmetries in soft tissue mobility associated with myofascial pain; This study uses optical skin surface tracking and derived strain-based biomarkers to identify asymmetrical distinctions in bilateral soft tissue mobility that correspond with self-reported myofascial pain.

Direct 3D Printing of Shear‐Thinning Hydrogels into Self‐Healing Hydrogels; This paper describes the use of supramolecular, shear-thinning hydrogels for the direct 3D printing of high-resolution, multi-material structures into self-healing support gels.

Biofabrication strategies for 3D in vitro models and regenerative medicine; This review examines biofabrication strategies for constructing 3D in vitro tissue models and functional tissue replacements, focusing on the development of processable biomaterials like supramolecular and photosensitive hydrogels.

3D Printing of Shear-Thinning Hyaluronic Acid Hydrogels with Secondary Cross-Linking; This study develops a dual-cross-linking hyaluronic acid hydrogel system that combines shear-thinning guest-host bonds for 3D printing fidelity and covalent photopolymerization for long-term structural stability.

Recent advances in hyaluronic acid hydrogels for biomedical applications; This review highlights recent advances in hyaluronic acid (HA) hydrogels for biomedical applications, covering new modifications for crosslinking, composite designs, and advanced processing techniques like 3D printing.

A Generalizable Strategy for the 3D Bioprinting of Hydrogels from Nonviscous Photo‐crosslinkable Inks; This paper presents a generalizable bioprinting method that enables 3D printing of hydrogel structures from nonviscous, photo-crosslinkable inks by crosslinking the material in situ immediately prior to deposition.

Computational Fluid Dynamic Model Prediction of Enhanced Glymphatic Clearance in Response to Focused Ultrasound‐Mediated Blood‐Brain Barrier Opening; This study uses a 3D finite element COMSOL model to predict that focused ultrasound-mediated blood-brain barrier opening enhances glymphatic waste clearance by increasing both diffusion and convection.

Focused Ultrasound Crosslinkable Granular Hydrogels; This work develops a focused ultrasound (FUS) crosslinkable granular hydrogel system composed of FUS-responsive microgels and fibers, offering a novel, noninvasive method for stabilizing regenerative hydrogels.

Engineering Granular Hydrogels without Interparticle Cross-Linking to Support Multicellular Organization; This study develops and characterizes a polyethylene glycol-based granular hydrogel system without interparticle cross-linking that exhibits bulk stress-relaxing behaviors and is permissive to multicellular self-organization.

Conformal encapsulation of mammalian stem cells using modified hyaluronic acid; This paper reports a system for conformally encapsulating stem cells by depositing and crosslinking a modified hyaluronic acid hydrogel directly onto the cell plasma membrane.

Supramolecular fibrous hydrogel augmentation of uterosacral ligament suspension for treatment of pelvic organ prolapse; This study describes the first use of an injectable, fibrous hyaluronic acid hydrogel composite to augment uterosacral ligament suspension (USLS) in a rat model, showing improved mechanical properties post-operatively.

Dynamic optimal control for groundwater remediation with flexible management periods; This paper combines a successive approximation linear quadratic regulator (SALQR) with management periods and a finite element model to determine optimal, time-varying pump-and-treat policies for groundwater remediation with reduced computational demand.

Modeling the desorption of organic contaminants from long-term contaminated soil using distributed mass transfer rates; This study develops a finite difference contaminant transport model with a distribution of mass transfer rates that provides significantly improved simulations of trichloroethene desorption from long-term contaminated soils.

Constraint handling for genetic algorithms in optimal remediation design; This paper compares two constraint handling methods for genetic algorithms in optimal groundwater remediation design, finding that a multiplicative penalty method produces a set of feasible and near-optimal solutions.

Groundwater remediation design under uncertainty using genetic algorithms; This work develops a robust genetic algorithm (GA) approach for groundwater remediation design that accounts for hydraulic conductivity uncertainty by varying realizations between GA generations.

Optimal control for groundwater remediation by differential dynamic programming with quasi‐Newton approximations; This paper combines differential dynamic programming with quasi-Newton approximations (QNDDP) and a finite element model to determine optimal time-varying pumping policies for groundwater remediation with reduced computational effort.

Validating Nitrogen Removal Models with Field Bioretention Data; This work validates two versions of a three-nitrogen-pool (3P) model against field bioretention data, finding that the 3P-m model provides improved predictions of nitrogen transport and removal.

Assessing and improving the outcomes of nonpoint source water quality trading policies in urban areas: A case study in Virginia; This case study in Virginia quantifies the impact of nonpoint source water quality trading (WQT) on an urban catchment, finding that it increased total phosphorus loading and that collocating buyers and sellers could mitigate this.

Developing nitrogen removal models for stormwater bioretention systems; This study develops and evaluates six different nitrogen removal models (NRMs) for stormwater bioretention systems, calibrating and validating them against a year-long dataset to improve design optimization.

Integrating social equity into multiobjective optimization of urban stormwater low-impact development; This study integrates a novel spatial social equity objective into a multiobjective optimization model for urban stormwater low-impact development (LID/GI) to address inequitable distribution.

Assessing the Impact of Antecedent Dry Period and Storm Volume on Nitrogen Transport in Biochar-Amended and Compost-Amended Roadway Soils; This study compares nitrogen concentrations in leachate from biochar-amended and compost-amended roadside soils under simulated large storm events and increasing antecedent dry periods.

Predicting near-term train schedule performance and delay using bi-level random forests; This work proposes a novel bi-level random forest approach to accurately predict near-term passenger train delays in the Netherlands, outperforming several alternative statistical and machine-learning models.

Hurricane-induced power outage risk under climate change is primarily driven by the uncertainty in projections of future hurricane frequency; This paper proposes an efficient framework to bridge physics-based hurricane projections and outage risk models, finding that uncertainty in future hurricane frequency is the primary driver of uncertainty in outage projections.

Divide and conquer: An incremental sparsity promoting compressive sampling approach for polynomial chaos expansions; This paper introduces an incremental sparsity-promoting compressive sampling approach for Polynomial Chaos (PC) expansions that breaks the dimensionality of the problem to achieve a sparser and more accurate recovery.

Survival analysis at multiple scales for the modeling of track geometry deterioration; This paper uses survival analysis at multiple scales to model track geometry deterioration, finding that fine-scale models of isolated defects improve the prediction quality of coarse-scale segment-based models.

A near-optimal sampling strategy for sparse recovery of polynomial chaos expansions; This paper proposes a near-optimal sampling strategy for the sparse recovery of polynomial chaos expansions that improves both local-coherence and cross-correlation properties of measurement matrices.

Bayesian theory of probabilistic forecasting via deterministic hydrologic model; This paper presents the fundamentals of a Bayesian forecasting system (BFS) that produces a probabilistic forecast of a hydrologic predictand by decomposing total uncertainty into input and hydrologic uncertainty.

The case for probabilistic forecasting in hydrology; This essay presents a compendium of reasons for probabilistic forecasting in hydrology, arguing that it is scientifically more honest, enables risk-based warnings, and offers additional economic benefits over deterministic forecasts.

A bivariate meta-Gaussian density for use in hydrology; This paper introduces the bivariate meta-Gaussian density, a flexible model constructed from the normal quantile transform that can represent a full range of association between hydrologic variates with arbitrary marginal distributions.

Bayesian system for probabilistic river stage forecasting; This article presents a synthesis of an analytic-numerical Bayesian forecasting system (BFS) for producing short-term probabilistic river stage forecasts, detailing its components, estimation procedures, and operational attributes.

Hydrologic uncertainty processor for probabilistic river stage forecasting; This paper presents the theory and development of the hydrologic uncertainty processor (HUP), a component of the Bayesian forecasting system that quantifies all non-precipitation-related uncertainties in river stage forecasting.
Probabilistic forecasts and optimal decisions

Ensemble Bayesian forecasting system Part II: Experiments and properties; This paper presents experiments with the ensemble Bayesian forecasting system with randomization (EBFSR), which enables the generation of a large hydrologic ensemble forecast from a small meteorologic input ensemble.

A Bayesian Approach to Statistical Post-Processing; This study prototypes a probabilistic National Blend of Models (NBM) using the Bayesian Processor of Ensemble (BPE) to address the challenges of combining, calibrating, and extending multiple NWP guidance products.

Stochastic models of severe weather watches and warnings: transition probabilities; This paper formulates one- and two-stage stochastic models to quantify the uncertainty in severe weather watches and warnings, using transition probabilities to characterize all possible sequences of alarms and events.
Bringing It All Together: A Prototype for a Probabilistic National Blend of Models

Review of resource-constrained scheduling algorithms; This study reviews and evaluates eight resource-constrained scheduling (RCS) algorithms to identify shortcomings that must be addressed for their application in delay analysis.

Performance of resource-constrained scheduling heuristics; This study proposes a new tiebreaker for resource-constrained scheduling heuristics and classifies their performance based on specific project characteristics, finding that the new tiebreaker enhances the performance of the late finish rule.

Assessing the Cost Forecasting Performance in Construction Projects through Data Envelopment Analysis; This paper uses Data Envelopment Analysis to assess the cost forecasting performance of construction projects, considering both the accuracy and timeliness of the forecasting methods.

Reemplazo del agregado fino por escoria de horno de cubilote para la fabricación de concreto; This work investigates the physico-mechanical properties of concrete made with cupola furnace slag as a substitute for fine aggregate, finding favorable compressive strength when replacing 20% of the sand.

Phantom float in commercial scheduling software; This paper illustrates the presence of "phantom float" in commercial scheduling software, which arises because existing resource-constrained scheduling methodologies neglect resource relationships between competing activities.

WIP: Developing an arts-informed approach to understand students’ perceptions of engineering; This work-in-progress paper describes a methodology using drawings to explore students' perceptions of engineering in introductory courses, aiming to facilitate meaningful reflection on their preconceptions.

An experimental comparison of four unit test criteria: Mutation, edge-pair, all-uses and prime path coverage; This paper presents an experimental comparison of four unit-level software testing criteria, finding that mutation testing detected more faults than edge-pair, all-uses, and prime path coverage.

Applying mutation testing to web applications; This paper presents a novel solution for integration testing of web applications using mutation analysis, defining new mutation operators and presenting a tool (webMuJava) that implements them.

An experimental evaluation of web mutation operators; This paper introduces, evaluates, and refines web mutation operators for targeting interaction faults in web applications, finding that mutation-adequate tests provide significantly higher coverage than traditional tests.

A logic mutation approach to selective mutation for programs and queries; This paper explores a logic mutation approach to selective mutation by generating only specially engineered subsuming higher-order logic mutants, finding that this can be more efficient and effective than traditional mutation.

Performance analysis of an asynchronous web server; This paper presents and validates a queuing model of an asynchronous web server implemented using the proactor pattern, demonstrating its use to guide configuration and provisioning decisions.

Report from the 4th Int. Workshop on Education through Advanced Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (EASEAI'22); This report summarizes the 4th International Workshop on Education through Advanced Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (EASEAI'22), which gathers researchers to discuss the integration of these fields in education.
EASEAI’22
Welcome from the Chairs

Report from the 3rd Int. Workshop on Education through Advanced Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (EASEAI'21); This report summarizes the 3rd International Workshop on Education through Advanced Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (EASEAI'21), which brings together researchers to discuss the combination of these fields in education.

Analysis of the transition to a virtual learning semester in a college software testing course; This report presents observations and analysis from the transition of a college software testing course from an in-person to a virtual learning semester during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Current progress and future challenges in rare-earth-free permanent magnets; This article reviews the current progress and future challenges in developing rare-earth-free permanent magnets, emphasizing the importance of understanding microstructure for improving coercivity and remanent magnetization.

Pt nanoclusters confined within metal–organic framework cavities for chemoselective cinnamaldehyde hydrogenation; This paper describes a highly selective and robust catalyst for cinnamaldehyde hydrogenation, consisting of Pt nanoclusters confined within the cavities of an amino-functionalized metal-organic framework (MOF).

Fatigue-resistant high-performance elastocaloric materials made by additive manufacturing; This study creates fatigue-resistant, high-performance elastocaloric cooling materials by using additive manufacturing to form a nickel-titanium nanocomposite with extremely small hysteresis and repeatable performance over 1 million cycles.
Cerium: An Unlikely Replacement of Dysprosium in High Performance Nd-Fe-B Permanent Magnets

Reactive metal–support interactions at moderate temperature in two-dimensional niobium-carbide-supported platinum catalysts; This paper reports a non-oxide-based reactive metal-support interaction (RMSI) between platinum and 2D Nb2CTx MXene, where a Pt-Nb surface alloy forms at moderate temperature, exhibiting weaker CO adsorption.

Terahertz near-field imaging of sidewall-induced losses in superconducting qubits; This paper demonstrates noninvasive terahertz (THz) nano-imaging of encapsulated niobium transmon qubits, identifying sidewall loss and discontinuity as major coherence limiters.

Decoupling size and surface effects of intermetallic CuPd nanocrystals for electrocatalytic nitrate reduction to ammonia; This study synthesizes size-tunable B2-phase CuPd intermetallic nanocrystals and demonstrates a volcano-like trend in their performance for the electrochemical nitrate reduction reaction (eNO3RR) to ammonia.

Optimizing Superconducting Qubits: Insights into Oxides Microstructures; This talk highlights recent advancements in understanding the contribution of surface oxides and Josephson junction barriers to decoherence in superconducting qubits, using transmission electron microscopy and spectroscopy techniques.

Topological Defect Mediated Helical Phase Reorientation by Uniaxial Stress; This study uses in situ Lorentz transmission electron microscopy to observe that helical domain reorientation under uniaxial stress is mediated by topological defects through "break-and-reconnect" or "dislocation gliding-annihilation" processes.

Reactivity of the gold/water interface during selective oxidation catalysis; This study uses labeling experiments and DFT calculations to show that during the selective oxidation of alcohols over supported gold catalysts, oxygen atoms from hydroxide ions, not molecular oxygen, are incorporated into the alcohol.

Fundamentals of chemical reaction engineering; This textbook introduces the quantitative treatment of chemical reaction engineering, covering both homogeneous and heterogeneous reacting systems and including numerous worked-out problems and real-world applications.

Selective oxidation of alcohols and aldehydes over supported metal nanoparticles; This paper examines the literature on selective oxidation of biomass-derived molecules over supported metal catalysts, comparing reaction rates in a consistent manner and providing recommendations for kinetic investigations.

Hydrogenolysis of glycerol over carbon-supported Ru and Pt catalysts; This study evaluates commercial carbon-supported Ru and Pt catalysts for the hydrogenolysis of glycerol, finding that Ru is more active at neutral pH while Pt is more selective to propylene glycol.

Selective hydrogenolysis of polyols and cyclic ethers over bifunctional surface sites on rhodium–rhenium catalysts; This study shows that a ReOx-promoted Rh/C catalyst is selective for the hydrogenolysis of secondary C-O bonds in polyols and cyclic ethers, proposing a bifunctional mechanism involving acid-catalyzed ring-opening and metal-catalyzed hydrogenation.
Catalytic Methanation of CO2 over Ni Nanoparticles for Production of Renewable Natural Gas from Biogas
Advanced Biogas Methanation Catalysts for Generating Renewable Natural Gas
Utilizing Site-Dependent NO Reduction to Probe Step Sites on Supported Pt Nanoparticles: A Combined Theoretical and Experimental Study
Combined Experimental and Theoretical Analysis for the Low-Temperature Formation of Nitrous Oxide on Pt/Al2O3

Revisiting the influence of Ni particle size on the hydrogenation of CO2 to CH4 over Ni/CeO2; This study revisits the influence of Ni particle size on CO2 methanation over Ni/CeO2, finding that the turnover frequency is independent of particle size and that ceria's main benefit is enhancing Ni reducibility.

In search of integration: Mapping conceptual efforts to apply STS to engineering education; This paper maps the conceptual efforts to apply Science, Technology, and Society (STS) to engineering education, analyzing the discourse of ASEE and mentoring experiences to understand how STS informs design and research.

Teaching STS to engineers: A comparative study of embedded STS programs; This work-in-progress paper examines the character of STS programs embedded in engineering schools, comparing them to standalone courses as a powerful model for providing engineering students with crucial nontechnical skills.

Using generative ai as an active learning tool to refine professional engineering skills; This paper underscores the importance of nontechnical engineering skills learned through Science, Technology, and Society (STS) and explores how generative AI can be used as an active learning tool to refine written communication.

Applying STS to Engineering Education: A Comparative Study of STS Minors; This paper analyzes the design, purpose, and execution of STS minors in STEM-focused institutions to understand how they are designed to provide critical education and attract engineering students.

AI Unleashed: Navigating Ethical Integration of Generative Tools in an Undergraduate Classroom; This paper moves beyond preliminary discussions to introduce faculty to a new narrative about the inevitability of AI, empowering them to become informed advocates for ethical AI practices in the undergraduate classroom.

Choreographing Virtue: The Role of Situatedness and Layering in Building Moral Muscle Memory in Engineering Ethics Education; This paper explores how a situated and competency-layering pedagogy can enhance the effectiveness of the Giving Voice to Values (GVV) framework for teaching ethical leadership in engineering.

Incorporating Giving Voice to Values (GVV) into an Engineering Ethics Course; This paper provides an overview of a new engineering ethics course that incorporates the Giving Voice to Values (GVV) framework to help students understand how to act on their personal ethics.
Perspective on the future of silicon photonics and electronics

Photonic chip-based low-noise microwave oscillator; This work demonstrates a chip-based, low-noise microwave oscillator that uses two-point optical frequency division with a dark soliton frequency comb to down-convert an ultrastable optical reference.

Integrated self-healing for mm-wave power amplifiers; This paper describes and investigates an integrated self-healing technique for improving the performance and yield of millimeter-wave power amplifiers against process variation, load mismatch, and transistor failure.

Interference Robust Detector-First Near-Zero Power Wake-Up Receiver; This paper presents an interference-robust, detector-first, near-zero power wake-up receiver (WuRX) that achieves high sensitivity and low power operation through a passive detector design and integrated offset compensation.
Low power receiver and related circuits

A Sub-μW Digital Temperature Compensation Architecture for Arbitrary Voltage and Current Reference Generation; This paper proposes a sub-μwatt digital temperature compensation architecture that generates voltage and current references with a user-defined temperature response, allowing it to cancel non-linearities in the components it supplies.

Additive Phase-Noise Reduction in Microwave Regenerative Dividers; This paper presents a detailed investigation of a method to reduce additive phase noise in regenerative frequency dividers, demonstrating a low-noise, octave-spanning divider in a 250-nm InP HBT process.

Feature Selection: A Data Perspective; This survey provides a comprehensive and structured overview of recent advances in feature selection research from a data perspective, covering algorithms for conventional, structured, heterogeneous, and streaming data.

Deep Anomaly Detection on Attributed Networks; This paper proposes a deep anomaly detection model for attributed networks that uses a graph convolutional autoencoder to capture complex interactions between network structure and node attributes.

Self-Supervised Multi-Channel Hypergraph Convolutional Network for Social Recommendation; This paper proposes a self-supervised multi-channel hypergraph convolutional network to enhance social recommendation by leveraging high-order user relations, which are under-explored in existing models.

A Survey of Learning Causality with Data: Problems and Methods; This survey provides a comprehensive and structured review of both traditional and frontier methods in learning causality and causal relations, highlighting the connections between causality and machine learning in the era of big data.

Label Informed Attributed Network Embedding; This paper investigates how to incorporate noisy and incomplete label information to improve attributed network embedding, proposing a joint optimization framework to learn more effective vector representations.

Graph Foundation Models: A Comprehensive Survey; This survey provides a comprehensive overview of Graph Foundation Models (GFMs), unifying diverse efforts under a modular framework to guide research in this rapidly evolving field of general-purpose AI for structured data.

FedHERO: A Federated Learning Approach for Node Classification Task on Heterophilic Graphs; This paper proposes FedHERO, a federated graph learning framework with a dual-channel GNN and structure learner, designed to effectively handle node classification tasks on heterophilic graphs with varying neighbor distributions.

Are We Merely Justifying Results ex Post Facto?
