Loss of NF1 in melanoma confers sensitivity to SYK kinase inhibition; This study identifies that loss of NF1 in melanoma confers sensitivity to SYK kinase inhibition, demonstrating that a tool compound, MTX-216, effectively blocks tumor growth by inhibiting both PI3K and SYK, leading to the suppression of mitochondrial electron transport chain genes.

Patterned electroconvection under AC and DC voltages with strong unipolar charge injection; This article explores how electroconvection can be induced using a patterned membrane and strong unipolar charge injection under both DC and AC voltages, using a specialized flow simulation to find the optimal pattern ratio for achieving the highest time-averaged current density.

Developing Numerical Methods and Optimal Boundary Conditions for Enhancing Electroconvection Under AC Voltage; This dissertation explores the induction of electroconvection under AC and DC voltages using patterned surfaces with unipolar charge injection, developing a specialized adaptive time-stepping algorithm to simulate the system and identify optimal pattern designs for enhancing ion transport.

Numerical Simulation of Pattern Accelerated Electroconvection; This work uses numerical simulation with an iterative algorithm to investigate and optimize patterned accelerated electroconvection, showing how alternating permeable and impermeable regions can increase ion transport and current density at polarized surfaces.

Impact of Surface Patterning on Electroconvection with Unipolar Charge Injection under AC and DC Voltages; This study investigates the impact of surface patterning on electroconvection with unipolar charge injection under both AC and DC voltages, aiming to understand how different patterns affect ion transport and current density.

Diameter-selective Raman scattering from vibrational modes in carbon nanotubes; This study uses Raman scattering with various laser excitation wavelengths to observe and identify numerous vibrational modes in single-wall carbon nanotubes, finding good agreement with lattice dynamics calculations and a nonresonant bond polarizability model.

Carbon nanotubes with DNA recognition; This paper demonstrates a method to unite the unique electronic properties of single-walled carbon nanotubes with the specific molecular-recognition features of DNA by coupling them to peptide nucleic acid and hybridizing them with complementary DNA for recognition-based assembly.

Purification of single-wall carbon nanotubes by microfiltration; This paper discusses a microfiltration-based purification procedure for single-wall carbon nanotubes that separates them from coexisting carbon nanospheres and metal nanoparticles without requiring oxidative treatment, achieving a purity in excess of 90%.

Monte Carlo simulations of H2 physisorption in finite-diameter carbon nanotube ropes; This paper reports the results of Monte Carlo simulations of H2 physisorption in finite-diameter carbon nanotube ropes, showing a strong dependence of adsorption on rope diameter and identifying high binding-energy sites in the external grooves.

Individual single-walled carbon nanotubes as nanoelectrodes for electrochemistry; This study demonstrates the use of individual metallic and semiconducting single-walled carbon nanotubes as nanoelectrodes for electrochemistry, observing similar steady-state voltammetric curves for both types and resolving very fast interfacial electron transfer rates.

Work in Progress: A Novel Two-Semester Course Sequence that Integrates Engineering Design, Sociotechnical Skills, Career Development, and Academic Advising; This work-in-progress paper presents the design and implementation of a new two-semester first-year engineering course sequence that integrates engineering design, sociotechnical skills, career development, and academic advising, with faculty serving as both professor and advisor.

Gd2@C79N: Isolation, Characterization, and Monoadduct Formation of a Very Stable Heterofullerene with a Magnetic Spin State of S = 15/2; This paper reports the preparation, isolation, and characterization of the dimetallic endohedral heterofullerene Gd2@C79N, an exceptionally stable paramagnetic molecule with a high magnetic spin state of S = 15/2.

Vibrational spectrum of the endohedral C@C fullerene by Raman spectroscopy: Evidence for tunneling of the diatomic molecule; This study uses Raman spectroscopy and density functional theory to investigate the vibrational spectrum of the endohedral fullerene C2@C84, reporting evidence for quantum tunneling of the diatomic C2 unit through its rotation plane.

Raman study of Fano interference in p‐type doped silicon; This study uses Raman spectroscopy with a wide range of excitation wavelengths to investigate the Fano interference effect on the zone center optical phonon in heavily p-type doped silicon, identifying a transition in the electronic excitation spectrum.

Noise analysis of carbon nanotube field effect transistors irradiated by electron beam; Using current noise measurements, this study investigates the effects of electron beam exposure on carbon nanotube field-effect transistors, finding that high doses induce a potential barrier in p-type semiconducting nanotubes, likely due to trapped charges in the underlying SiO2.

Accelerated search for materials with targeted properties by adaptive design; This paper demonstrates how an adaptive design strategy, tightly coupled with experiments, can accelerate the discovery of new materials by sequentially identifying the next most informative experiments, successfully applying it to find NiTi-based shape memory alloys with very low thermal hysteresis.

Active learning in materials science with emphasis on adaptive sampling using uncertainties for targeted design; This review discusses how active learning, particularly using uncertainties and utility functions to guide adaptive sampling, can accelerate the search and discovery of new materials by efficiently navigating the vast experimental and computational search space.

Accelerated Discovery of Large Electrostrains in BaTiO3‐Based Piezoelectrics Using Active Learning; This study demonstrates how machine learning coupled with optimization methods can accelerate the discovery of new Pb-free BaTiO3-based piezoelectrics, leading to the synthesis of (Ba0.84Ca0.16)(Ti0.90Zr0.07Sn0.03)O3 with the largest electrostrain of 0.23% in the BTO family.

Experimental search for high-temperature ferroelectric perovskites guided by two-step machine learning; This paper demonstrates a two-step machine learning approach, combining classification to screen for perovskite structures and active learning to guide synthesis, to accelerate the experimental search for high-temperature ferroelectric perovskites in a vast chemical space.

An informatics approach to transformation temperatures of NiTi-based shape memory alloys; This study demonstrates that a statistical learning approach using three material descriptors related to chemical bonding and atomic radii can accurately predict the martensitic transformation temperatures of NiTi-based shape memory alloys.

Type-1.5 SNSPD: Interacting vortex theory of two bandgap superconducting single photon detectors; This paper develops the theory for a new class of type-1.5 superconducting nanowire single photon detectors based on two-bandgap superconductors like MgB2, showing that unique vortex-vortex interactions can lead to multiple vortex seeding from a single photon and suppressed dark counts.

Large‐Scale Interlaboratory Study Along the Entire Process Chain of Laser Powder Bed Fusion: Bridging Variability, Standards, and Optimization across Metals and Polymers; This paper presents results from a comprehensive interlaboratory study on laser powder bed fusion involving 32 institutions, which used advanced statistical methods and machine learning on a dataset of over 1.2 million correlations to identify critical variability drivers across the entire production chain for metals and polymers.

Broadband optical phonon scattering reduces the thermal conductivity of multi-cation oxides; This study experimentally and computationally investigates thermal transport in a series of rare earth sesquioxides and zirconates, finding that a reduction in thermal conductivity in multi-cation oxides is directly correlated to broadband optical phonon scattering caused by local bonding distortions.

Towards" on-demand" van der Waals epitaxy with hpc-driven online ensemble sampling; This work combines high-performance computing, machine learning, and molecular dynamics within an adaptive Bayesian optimization framework to enable asynchronous ensemble sampling of the synthesis space for van der Waals epitaxy, demonstrating its potential for on-demand materials discovery.

An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time; In response to the COVID-19 public health emergency, this paper describes the development of an online interactive dashboard at Johns Hopkins University to visualize and track reported cases, deaths, and recoveries in real time.

Association between mobility patterns and COVID-19 transmission in the USA: a mathematical modelling study; This mathematical modeling study used anonymized cell phone data to generate a social distancing metric for each US county, finding a strong correlation between the reduction in mobility and the reduction in COVID-19 transmission rates during the early phase of the pandemic.

The Johns Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering COVID-19 Dashboard: data collection process, challenges faced, and lessons learned; This Personal View details the data collection, curation, and management system underlying the Johns Hopkins University COVID-19 Dashboard, covering the technical processes, challenges faced, and lessons learned during its operation as a global real-time surveillance system.

COVID-19 Dashboard by the center for systems science and engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University (JHU); This entry refers to the COVID-19 Dashboard created by the Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University (JHU).

An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time (vol 20, pg 533, 2020); This is a correction to a previously published article about the interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time.

SafeTraffic Copilot: adapting large language models for trustworthy traffic safety assessments and decision interventions; This paper introduces SafeTraffic Copilot, a system that adapts Large Language Models to perform expected traffic crash prediction as a text-reasoning task and then uses a novel attribution method to identify critical features for targeted safety interventions.

Improving policy design and epidemic response using integrated models of economic choice and disease dynamics with behavioral feedback; This paper introduces a feedback-informed epidemiological model that integrates a dynamic economic decision-making model with a compartmental disease model to show how accounting for disease-behavior feedback significantly impacts the predicted health and economic outcomes of public health policies.

From Data to Decisions: Engineering Pathways to Equitable and Resilient Public Health Systems; This dissertation embodies engineering approaches to advance infectious disease modeling by developing multimodal machine learning frameworks for short-term forecasting and by creating a Feedback-Informed Epidemiological Model to simulate human health-wealth trade-offs in complex systems.

Advancing real-time infectious disease forecasting using large language models; This paper introduces PandemicLLM, a framework that uses multi-modal large language models to reformulate real-time infectious disease forecasting as a text-reasoning problem, enabling the incorporation of complex, non-numerical information like public health policies and genomic data.

Can A Society of Generative Agents Simulate Human Behavior and Inform Public Health Policy? A Case Study on Vaccine Hesitancy; This work investigates the feasibility of using a society of generative agents powered by Large Language Models to simulate human health-related decision-making, using vaccine hesitancy as a case study to evaluate public health interventions in a simulated environment.

Adverse events in robotic surgery: a retrospective study of 14 years of FDA data; By analyzing 14 years of adverse event data from the FDA's MAUDE database, this retrospective study found 144 deaths and 1,391 injuries related to robotic surgery, with device malfunctions like falling broken instrument pieces and electrical arcing being common causes.

Targeted Attacks on Teleoperated Surgical Robots: Dynamic Model-based Detection and Mitigation; This paper demonstrates targeted cyber-physical attacks on teleoperated surgical robots that can cause catastrophic consequences and presents a dynamic model-based analysis framework that can detect and mitigate these malicious commands with 90% accuracy.

On the safety of machine learning: Cyber-physical systems, decision sciences, and data products; This article formalizes the definition of machine learning safety in terms of risk, epistemic uncertainty, and harm, and uses this framework to examine safety strategies across cyber-physical systems, decision sciences, and data products.

Analysis of safety-critical computer failures in medical devices; This article investigates the causes of safety-critical computer failures in medical devices by analyzing FDA recall and adverse event data, characterizing failure modes and their impact on patients to identify key safety issues.

A review of cognitive assistants for healthcare: Trends, prospects, and future directions; This survey provides a comprehensive review of Healthcare Cognitive Assistants (HCAs), bridging a knowledge gap by identifying emerging trends, key challenges, design guidelines, and state-of-the-art technologies for researchers across multiple domains.

Knowsafe: Combined knowledge and data driven hazard mitigation in artificial pancreas systems; This paper proposes KnowSafe, a combined knowledge and data-driven approach for designing safety engines that can predict and mitigate hazards in cyber-physical systems like artificial pancreas systems by integrating domain-specific safety constraints with machine learning techniques.

Systems-Theoretic and Data-Driven Security Analysis in ML-enabled Medical Devices; This paper underscores the urgency of addressing cybersecurity in ML-enabled medical devices during the pre-market phase by analyzing public data on recalls and vulnerabilities, and introduces a suite of tools to assist security analysts in conducting comprehensive risk assessments.

Safety Interventions against Adversarial Patches in an Open-Source Driver Assistance System; This paper evaluates the resilience of a widely used advanced driver assistance system (ADAS) against safety-critical perception attacks, simulating various safety mechanisms to assess their impact on mitigating attacks and enhancing system resilience.

Runtime Stealthy Perception Attacks against DNN-based Adaptive Cruise Control Systems; This paper evaluates the security of DNN-based Adaptive Cruise Control systems against runtime stealthy perception attacks, presenting a context-aware strategy for triggering attacks and an optimization-based method for generating image perturbations to cause forward collisions.

SAM: Foreseeing Inference-Time False Data Injection Attacks on ML-enabled Medical Devices; This paper introduces SAM, a technique that enables security analysts to perform System Theoretic Process Analysis for Security on ML-enabled medical devices during the design phase to foresee and mitigate risks from false data injection attacks at inference time.

Overview of the fundamental reactions and degradation mechanisms of NOx storage/reduction catalysts; This paper reviews the fundamental reaction processes and degradation mechanisms of NOx storage/reduction catalysts, covering NO oxidation, NOx sorption, reductant evolution, NOx release, and the impact of aging and sulfur poisoning on catalyst performance.

Interaction of molecular oxygen with the vacuum-annealed TiO2 (110) surface: molecular and dissociative channels; This study examines the interaction of molecular oxygen with the TiO2(110) surface, showing that O2 adsorption and dissociation only occur in the presence of surface oxygen vacancy defects, which can be quantified using water temperature-programmed desorption.

Review of methane catalytic cracking for hydrogen production; This paper reviews the process of methane catalytic cracking for producing carbon monoxide-free hydrogen, discussing its economic challenges compared to other methods and highlighting extensive research aimed at improving its efficiency and catalyst stability.

Diesel oxidation catalysts; This review describes the history, configuration, and fundamental reactions of the diesel oxidation catalyst (DOC), covering its primary functions of oxidizing CO, hydrocarbons, and NO, as well as its deactivation mechanisms.

Insights into photoexcited electron scavenging processes on TiO2 obtained from studies of the reaction of O2 with OH groups adsorbed at electronic defects on TiO2 (110); This study shows that molecular oxygen reacts with bridging OH groups formed at oxygen vacancy defects on the TiO2(110) surface, providing insights into photoexcited electron scavenging processes on TiO2 photocatalysts.

Forced dynamic operation for acrylonitrile manufacture; This disclosure describes a process for acrylonitrile manufacture using forced dynamic operation over transition metal promoted bismuth molybdate-based catalysts, which leverages catalyst lattice oxygen to improve acrylonitrile productivity and yield.

Impact of Sulfur and Hydrothermal Aging on NOx Reduction over Cu-CHA Catalysts; This study investigates the impact of sulfur and hydrothermal aging on the performance of Cu-CHA catalysts for NOx reduction in selective catalytic reduction systems.

Modeling of Cu/SSZ-13 SCR Catalyst Sulfation and HTA-Induced Changes in ZCuOH and Z 2 Cu Site Distribution; This work utilizes an integrated experimental and kinetic modeling approach to examine the effect of combined hydrothermal aging and sulfur poisoning on the standard SCR reaction rate over Cu/SSZ-13 catalysts by modeling the transformation of Cu sites.

Impact of Cu Speciation in Cu/SSZ-13 on Oxidation Reactions; This study investigates how the speciation of copper within Cu/SSZ-13 catalysts influences their performance in various oxidation reactions relevant to selective catalytic reduction systems.

Effects of Sulfur Exposure on Cu Speciation and NH3 Storage in SSZ-13; This study examines the effects of sulfur exposure on the speciation of copper and the ammonia storage capacity in SSZ-13 catalysts used for selective catalytic reduction.

TracKnee: Knee angle measurement using stretchable conductive fabric sensors; This paper proposes TracKnee, a sensing knee sleeve with a stretchable conductive fabric sensor, and presents three models to calculate knee angles from voltage readings, which were evaluated in a user study with six participants.

Parkinson's disease action tremor detection with supervised-leaning models; This paper introduces a supervised-learning method to detect Parkinson's Disease action tremors from regular activities using data from wrist-worn accelerometers and gyroscopes, comparing hand-crafted features with CNN data-driven features.

MobiGesture: Mobility-aware hand gesture recognition for healthcare; This paper proposes MobiGesture, a mobility-aware hand gesture recognition system for healthcare that uses a novel segmentation algorithm and a Convolutional Neural Network to accurately classify hand gestures even when the user is moving.

TremorSense: Tremor Detection for Parkinson's Disease Using Convolutional Neural Network; This paper proposes TremorSense, a Parkinson's Disease hand tremor detection system that uses a Convolutional Neural Network and data from wrist-worn accelerometers and gyroscopes to classify rest, postural, and action tremors.

Microsleep prediction using an EKG capable heart rate monitor; This paper designs a system that detects and predicts microsleep episodes using data from an EKG-capable heart rate monitor, achieving 96% detection accuracy and 83% prediction accuracy within 15 seconds to 5 minutes before the event.

DermaGlow: Objective Quantification of Melanin, Erythema and Skin-tone Using Wearable Optical Spectroscopy; This paper introduces DermaGlow, a novel wearable optical spectroscopy framework designed for low-cost, non-invasive, and continuous monitoring of melanin, erythema, and skin tone using an off-the-shelf spectrometer and a custom-designed 3D-printed enclosure.

A Multi-Wavelength Optical Sensing Framework for Calibration-Free Wearable Blood Pressure Monitoring; This paper introduces a novel multi-wavelength optical sensing framework for calibration-free wearable blood pressure monitoring that utilizes a broad spectrum of wavelengths and interpretable features combined with machine learning to accurately estimate blood pressure.

Precision Rehabilitation After Youth Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction: Individualized Reinjury Risk Stratification and Modifiable Risk Factor Identification to Guide …; This cohort study developed an ACL reinjury risk prediction model for adolescent athletes that accurately classifies an individual's risk, identifies modifiable risk factors, and ranks them to guide personalized rehabilitation.

Supporting interruption management and multimodal interface design: Three meta-analyses of task performance as a function of interrupting task modality; This paper presents three meta-analyses integrating empirical data on the effects of interrupting task modality (auditory, tactile, visual) on the performance of an ongoing visual-manual task to support interruption management and multimodal interface design.

Extending Fitts’ law in three-dimensional virtual environments with current low-cost virtual reality technology; This study explores the applicability of Fitts' law to 3D pointing tasks in virtual reality using the Oculus Rift system, proposing a new formulation that accounts for the influence of target location specified in a spherical coordinate system.

Informing the design of multimodal displays: A meta-analysis of empirical studies comparing auditory and tactile interruptions; To inform the design of multimodal cockpit interfaces, this paper presents a meta-analysis of 23 studies comparing the effectiveness of auditory versus tactile interruption signals, finding that while tactile interruptions yield faster responses, auditory signals are better for complex and urgent information.

Effects of workload and workload transitions on attention allocation in a dual-task environment: Evidence from eye tracking metrics; Using performance and eye tracking metrics in a dual-task UAV simulation, this study investigated how constant versus variable workload levels affect operator attention, finding that sudden workload transitions led to better secondary task performance and more attention switching.

Crossmodal matching: A critical but neglected step in multimodal research; This paper highlights the critical but neglected step of crossmodal matching in multimodal research, demonstrating through an experiment that even minor variations in matching procedures can lead to significant differences in perceived stimulus intensities across senses.

Deep learning-assisted system improves practical effect in cervical cytopathology diagnosis: A comparative study of reading modes; This randomized, controlled, four-way crossover study assesses the effectiveness of four different deep learning-assisted reading modes for cervical cytopathology, finding that all DL-assisted modes improved diagnostic accuracy and efficiency compared to unassisted reading.

A Survey on Tactile Change Blindness; This paper surveys the research literature on tactile change blindness, summarizing findings on how parameters like the number of tactors, stimulus intensity, and distractors impact the human ability to detect changes in tactile signals, with the goal of improving haptic display design.

Intensity-Based Tactile Changes are Detected Faster Than Location-Based Tactile Changes; Using a two-alternative forced choice paradigm and EEG, this study compared tactile change detection for stimuli defined by intensity versus location, finding that while detection sensitivity was similar, behavioral responses to intensity-based changes were nearly 100 ms faster.

Predicting Mental Demand of Teammates Using Eye Tracking Metrics: A Machine Learning Approach; This study explores the feasibility of using gaze-based machine learning models to classify the mental demand of teammates in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle command-and-control teams, finding that a k-Nearest Neighbors classifier achieved the highest accuracy (81%) in predicting workload levels.

Smart textiles for personalized healthcare; This review examines the development of smart textiles for personalized healthcare, covering different platform technologies, fabrication strategies, and clinical applications, while also exploring the commercial, regulatory, and data management landscapes.

Electronic textiles for wearable point-of-care systems; This review comprehensively summarizes research advances in electronic textiles for wearable point-of-care systems, covering textile sensors for diagnosis, therapeutic devices for treatment, and protective devices for prevention, highlighting their working mechanisms and materials.

Nanogenerators for smart cities in the era of 5G and Internet of Things; This review provides a comprehensive overview of the applications of nanogenerators as sustainable power sources and self-powered active sensors for smart cities in the era of 5G and IoT, covering areas like renewable energy, intelligent transportation, and digital healthcare.

Giant magnetoelastic effect in soft systems for bioelectronics; This paper reports a giant magnetoelastic effect in a soft composite system of micromagnets dispersed in a silicone matrix, which, when combined with liquid-metal coils, can be used for stretchable and water-resistant magnetoelastic sensors and energy harvesters.

Muscle fibers inspired high‐performance piezoelectric textiles for wearable physiological monitoring; This paper describes the development of a muscle-fiber-inspired nonwoven piezoelectric textile made from polydopamine-enhanced barium titanate/polyvinylidene fluoride nanofibers, which exhibits tunable mechanical properties and high performance for wearable physiological monitoring.

A soft magnetoelastic sensor to decode levels of fatigue; This paper reports a soft, self-powered, on-eyelid magnetoelastic sensor that can capture eye-blink parameters in real time to quantitatively decode fatigue levels by converting eye movements into high-fidelity electrical signals.

Neural network-assisted personalized handwriting analysis for Parkinson’s disease diagnostics; This paper describes a diagnostic pen with a soft magnetoelastic tip and ferrofluid ink that, assisted by a convolutional neural network, can quantitatively analyze both on-surface and in-air handwriting motions to distinguish Parkinson's disease patients from healthy individuals with 96.22% accuracy.

Advances in 2D materials for wearable biomonitoring; This review provides a comprehensive overview of wearable biosensors based on two-dimensional materials, highlighting their unique properties, synthesis methods, and integration into flexible electronic systems for advancements in health monitoring and personalized medicine.

Leveraging giant magnetoelasticity in soft matter for acoustic energy harvesting; This paper describes a soft acoustic energy harvester based on the giant magnetoelastic effect that efficiently captures energy from low-density environmental sounds by converting multi-directional acoustic waves into electrical energy across a wide frequency range.

Diagnosing Parkinson’s disease via behavioral biometrics of keystroke dynamics; This paper describes a soft, portable intelligent keyboard that leverages magnetoelasticity to detect subtle pressure variations in keystroke dynamics, enabling the quantitative analysis of Parkinson's disease motor symptoms with machine learning.

Fighting traffic: the dawn of the motor age in the American city; In "Fighting Traffic," Peter Norton argues that the American city street was socially and physically reconstructed between 1915 and 1930 to accommodate automobiles, a violent revolution that redefined streets as motor thoroughfares and marginalized pedestrians.

Street rivals: Jaywalking and the invention of the motor age street; This article argues that automotive interest groups in the 1910s and 1920s socially reconstructed the American street as a place for cars by promoting the term "jaywalker" to ridicule and delegitimize pedestrians' traditional use of street space.

Four Paradigms: Traffic Safety in the Twentieth-Century United States; To correct for ahistorical interpretations of traffic safety history, this paper proposes four approximately sequential paradigms for the twentieth-century United States: Safety First, Control, Crashworthiness, and Responsibility.

Autonorama: the illusory promise of high-tech driving; In "Autonorama," technology historian Peter Norton argues that the promise of high-tech driving and driverless cars is an illusion distracting us from investing in better, more humane mobility solutions that are available now.
Fighting traffic; This book, "Fighting Traffic," details the social and physical transformation of the American city street during the dawn of the motor age to accommodate the automobile.

The Mismeasure of the American Street.; This article argues that the typical American city street was radically transformed in the twentieth century by novel standards that prioritized vehicular functions, leading to the privatization of public space and the marginalization of other valuable urban uses.

Normalising fast driving: the radical revision of traffic safety in the United States, 1920–1940; This paper argues that a radical revision in public policy between 1920 and 1940 redefined American streets from public spaces for all to motor thoroughfares, shifting the burden of safety from the minority of motorists to the majority of pedestrians.

Book Review: Justice and the Interstates: The Racist Truth about Urban Highways by Ryan Reft, Amanda K. Phillips de Lucas and Rebecca C. Retzlaff (eds); This book review of "Justice and the Interstates" critiques the anthology for presenting the racist history of urban highways in the United States as a new revelation, when in fact this truth has been recognized for over 50 years.

Book Review: No Bicycle, No Bus, No Job: The Making of Workers’ Mobility in the Netherlands, 1920–1990 by Patrick Bek; This book review of "No Bicycle, No Bus, No Job" praises Patrick Bek's work for addressing the under-examined history of power struggles over the responsibility for workers' daily journeys to and from their jobs in the Netherlands.

Consuming Landscapes: What We See When We Drive and Why It Matters by Thomas Zeller; This is a book review of Thomas Zeller's "Consuming Landscapes," which examines driving as a constructed visual experience where road designers contrive scenic views for motorists.

Sub-threshold design for ultra low-power systems; This book chapter discusses the design of ultra-low-power systems, particularly focusing on register files and memories in sub-threshold circuits, which are critical for energy-constrained applications but dissipate significant leakage energy.

Body area sensor networks: Challenges and opportunities; This article discusses the challenges and opportunities for body area sensor networks, highlighting that research must address obstacles like size, cost, and compatibility before such networks can become widespread in healthcare and beyond.

Modeling and sizing for minimum energy operation in subthreshold circuits; This paper provides an analytical solution for the optimum supply and threshold voltages to minimize energy in subthreshold circuits for a given frequency, and shows that minimum-sized devices are theoretically optimal for reducing energy consumption.

A 256-kb 65-nm sub-threshold SRAM design for ultra-low-voltage operation; This paper explores the limits of low-voltage operation for SRAM, proposing an alternative bitcell that allows a 256-kb 65-nm test chip to operate in the sub-threshold region below 400 mV, offering substantial power savings for energy-constrained applications.

A Batteryless 19 W MICS/ISM-Band Energy Harvesting Body Sensor Node SoC for ExG Applications; This paper presents an ultra-low power, batteryless, 19 μW body sensor node SoC that harvests energy to acquire, process, and transmit ECG, EMG, and EEG data, demonstrating heart rate extraction and atrial fibrillation detection while running solely on harvested power.

EveractiveSelf-Powered SoC with Energy Harvesting, Wakeup Receiver, and Energy-Aware Subsystem; This paper describes the Everactive self-powered System-on-Chip, which integrates energy harvesting, a wakeup receiver, and an energy-aware subsystem for use in batteryless IoT applications.

A Compact, Power-Efficient, and On-the-Fly I2C-to-SPI Converter for Distributed E-Textile Systems; This paper presents a compact, power-efficient I2C-to-SPI converter chip for distributed e-textile systems that uses an on-the-fly conversion scheme to eliminate the need for data buffers and internal clock generation, thereby reducing area and power consumption.

A 0.36 mm2 On-the-Fly I2C-to-SPI Converter for E-Textile Applications; This paper presents a 0.36-mm2 I2C-to-SPI converter chip for E-textile applications that uses on-the-fly conversion to eliminate data buffers and clock generation, making it significantly smaller and more power-efficient than commercial alternatives.

Characterization of Stacked PV Cell Configurations in a Deep N-Well 65nm CMOS Technology; This paper presents a comparison of various on-chip photovoltaic cell configurations implemented in a 65nm CMOS technology to characterize their performance and enable designers to select an optimal configuration for specific energy harvesting applications.

Sustainable colloidal-silver-impregnated ceramic filter for point-of-use water treatment; This study manufactured and tested colloidal-silver-impregnated ceramic filters for household water treatment, quantifying their flow rate, pore-size distribution, and effectiveness in removing Escherichia coli bacteria.

Toward Understanding the Efficacy and Mechanism of Opuntia spp. as a Natural Coagulant for Potential Application in Water Treatment; This study quantitatively evaluates the coagulant properties of Opuntia spp. cactus for water treatment, finding it reduces turbidity by 98% in synthetic water samples and likely operates through an interparticle bridging mechanism.

Effect of ten quaternary ammonium cations on tetrachloromethane sorption to clay from water; This study investigated tetrachloromethane sorption from water to bentonite clay modified with ten different quaternary ammonium cations, finding that sorption behavior is characterized by either nonlinear adsorption or linear partitioning depending on the structure of the organic cation.

Sorption of nonionic organic contaminants to single and dual organic cation bentonites from water; This study investigated the sorption of nonionic organic contaminants to bentonite clay modified with single and dual organic cations, finding that long-chain alkyl groups interfere with adsorption while creating a partition medium for the solutes.

Global stressors on water quality and quantity; This article discusses the unequal global distribution of water quality and quantity, noting that developing countries often have less capacity to improve water quality and depend on lower-quality water for various uses, including drinking.

Associations Between Point-of-Use Water Treatment Interventions and Cognitive Scores among Children 5 Years of Age and Younger in Limpopo, South Africa; This study reports on a randomized controlled trial in rural South Africa that found no significant association between the use of two point-of-use water treatment technologies and the cognitive scores of children under five years old after two years of follow-up.

Combined Efficacy of Silver, Copper, and Hypochlorite Ions for Vector Control of Juvenile Aedes aegypti in Household Water Storage Containers; This study evaluates the larvicidal effects of silver, copper, and hypochlorite ions, finding that their combined application yields greater efficacy in suppressing the emergence of Aedes aegypti from household water storage containers compared to individual disinfectants alone.

Optimization of Shigella and Campylobacter Detection from Milk and Water and Differentiation of Viable Organisms Using Viability PCR; This study optimized and evaluated laboratory methods for detecting viable Campylobacter and Shigella bacteria in water and raw cow milk using viability polymerase chain reaction (PCR), identifying the most effective concentration and DNA extraction protocols for each sample type.

Effectiveness of the upscaled use of a silver-ceramic (silver ionization) technology to disinfect drinking water in tanks at schools in rural India (vol 22, pg 2233, 2024); This is a correction to a previously published article about the effectiveness of a silver-ceramic technology for disinfecting drinking water in school tanks in rural India.

Analyzing the Efficacy of Water Treatment Disinfectants as Vector Control: The Larvicidal Effects of Silver Nitrate, Copper Sulfate Pentahydrate, and Sodium Hypochlorite on …; This study assessed the larvicidal effects of silver, copper, and chlorine disinfectants on Aedes aegypti larvae at concentrations below drinking water limits, finding that sodium hypochlorite was most effective against early instars while silver nitrate was most effective against late instars.

Recent advances of lanthanum-based perovskite oxides for catalysis; This perspective article summarizes the recent development of lanthanum-based perovskite oxides as advanced, tunable catalysts for energy conversion applications and traditional heterogeneous reactions, highlighting their potential to replace noble metals.

Monodisperse MxFe3–xO4 (M = Fe, Cu, Co, Mn) Nanoparticles and Their Electrocatalysis for Oxygen Reduction Reaction; This study synthesized sub-10 nm nanoparticles of M(II)-substituted magnetite (MxFe3-xO4) and found that MnFe2O4 nanoparticles supported on carbon are as efficient as commercial Pt in catalyzing the oxygen reduction reaction in alkaline solution.

FePt and CoPt nanowires as efficient catalysts for the oxygen reduction reaction; This paper reports that FePt and CoPt nanowires supported on carbon exhibit enhanced catalytic activity and stability for the oxygen reduction reaction in acidic media compared to commercial Pt/C catalysts.

New approach to fully ordered fct-FePt nanoparticles for much enhanced electrocatalysis in acid; This paper describes a new approach to synthesize fully ordered face-centered tetragonal FePt nanoparticles that serve as a robust and highly active electrocatalyst for both the oxygen reduction reaction and hydrogen evolution reaction in acidic media.

Hard-magnet L10-CoPt nanoparticles advance fuel cell catalysis; This study synthesized ~9 nm hard-magnet L10-CoPt/Pt core/shell nanoparticles that exhibit enhanced activity and durability for the oxygen reduction reaction in fuel cells, exceeding DOE 2020 targets due to the ligand effect of Co and biaxial strain on the Pt shell.

Sustainable synthesis of polymer-grade ethylene via electrified acetylene semihydrogenation; This study demonstrates a sustainable route to polymer-grade ethylene by using 45 nm Cu nanocubes for the electrocatalytic semihydrogenation of acetylene in a flow reactor, achieving high ethylene selectivity and Faradaic efficiency while removing acetylene to parts-per-million levels.

Strain relaxation enhances ammonia electrosynthesis from nitrate on Cu/CuAu core/shell nanocrystals with ordered intermetallic layers; This work synthesized core/shell Cu/CuAu nanocubes with precisely controlled ordered intermetallic layers, demonstrating that strain relaxation in the shell enhances the electrocatalytic nitrate reduction reaction to produce ammonia with high efficiency and yield.

Electrocatalytic C N Coupling: Advances in Urea Synthesis and Opportunities for Alternative Products; This review highlights recent advances in catalyst design, quantification methods, and intermediate identification for the electrocatalytic synthesis of urea via C-N coupling, and explores future prospects for alternative C-N coupling products.

Single-atom molybdenum doping induces nickel oxide-to-hydroxide transformation for enhanced alkaline hydrogen evolution; This study reports that single-atom molybdenum doping in NiO significantly enhances its alkaline hydrogen evolution reaction activity by promoting the in situ transformation of NiO to active Ni(OH)2 sites, which accelerates the rate-limiting water dissociation step.

Cathodic Corrosion-Induced Structural Evolution of CuNi Electrocatalysts for Enhanced CO2 Reduction; This work investigates the structural evolution of CuNi nanoparticle electrocatalysts during CO2 reduction, finding that cathodic corrosion leads to Ni loss and the formation of defect-rich Cu nanoparticles, which enhances the Faradaic efficiency of multi-carbon products.

Beyond the dichotomy of students-as-consumers and personal transformation: what students want from their degrees and their engagement with knowledge; A longitudinal qualitative study of 47 students in three countries reveals that while most have instrumental reasons for studying, they are personally committed to the knowledge in their field and see it playing a key role in their future lives, challenging the simple dichotomy of students-as-consumers versus personal transformation.

Disciplinary socialization in first-year STEM students; This qualitative study of first-year STEM students at a large research university found a pattern of low engagement with their discipline's professional community, with most impactful socialization occurring prior to their enrollment in their chosen major.

The Journey of Becoming and Belonging: A Longitudinal Exploration of Socialization's Impact on STEM Students' Sense of Belonging; This dissertation uses a longitudinal embedded case study to explore how the socialization experiences of eight STEM students over four years influence their sense of belonging to both their discipline and their university.

Interdisciplinary collaboration in capstone courses; This paper describes the process and challenges of creating an interdisciplinary senior capstone course at a large research university to better prepare engineering students for the collaborative, cross-disciplinary work environment they will face after graduation.

GIFTS: Creative Reflection to Close the Semester; This GIFT paper describes a creative reflection assignment for first-year engineering students at the end of a semester, designed to help them synthesize their learning and connect their personal values and hobbies with their engineering work.

WIP: Using Challenge Essential Questions to Connect Technical, Social, and Ethical Content in a First-Year Engineering Program; This Work-In-Progress paper describes an intervention using Challenge Essential Questions to help first-year engineering students make meaningful connections between technical and sociotechnical content in a foundational engineering program.

Control systems with actuator saturation: analysis and design; This book systematically studies the analysis and design of control systems with actuator saturation, a ubiquitous and theoretically challenging nonlinearity in engineering systems.

Flocking of multi-agents with a virtual leader; This paper revisits the problem of multi-agent flocking, showing that even when only a fraction of agents are informed about a virtual leader's velocity, a previously proposed algorithm can still enable all agents to achieve the desired group movement.

A survey of distributed optimization; This survey paper offers a detailed overview of discrete-time and continuous-time distributed optimization algorithms for multi-agent systems, discussing their extensions and applications, particularly in power systems.

An analysis and design method for linear systems subject to actuator saturation and disturbance; This paper presents a method for estimating the domain of attraction for a linear system under a saturated feedback, deriving a simple condition in terms of an auxiliary feedback matrix that can be expressed as linear matrix inequalities for controller synthesis.
Low gain feedback; This book chapter discusses the use of low-gain feedback for a class of multi-input multi-output nonlinear systems that are input-output linearizable and of minimum-phase.

Distributed Semiglobal Nash Equilibrium Seeking for Robotic Systems Subject to Unknown Disturbances; This article develops a novel distributed control architecture for multi-robot systems that integrates adaptive neural networks with projection-based pseudogradient dynamics to enable each robot to seek its Nash equilibrium strategy without global information or prior knowledge of disturbances.

Distributed secondary control of energy storage units in a droop-controlled DC microgrid; This paper proposes a distributed secondary control scheme for energy storage units in a droop-controlled DC microgrid that simultaneously achieves global voltage regulation, proportional power sharing, and state-of-energy balancing using two auxiliary control inputs.

New Conditions and Controllers for State-of-Charge Balancing in Battery Energy Storage Systems; This paper investigates the state-of-charge balancing control problem for a battery energy storage system, introducing the concept of "powered SoC" and designing a new power allocating controller that achieves accelerated balancing speed.

Privacy-Preserving Distributed Control for a Networked Battery Energy Storage System; This paper presents a novel privacy-preserving distributed control algorithm for state-of-charge balancing in a networked Battery Energy Storage System, which uses two distributed estimators to ensure asymptotic balancing and accurate power delivery while safeguarding agent privacy.

Oscillator Potts machines: An overdamped Langevin model for low-energy sampling of the standard Potts model; This work presents a compact and physically realizable Langevin model, called an Oscillator Potts Machine, that serves as a sampler for finding the low-energy spin configurations of the standard Potts model.

Temperature-aware microarchitecture; This paper describes HotSpot, an accurate and fast thermal model for microprocessors, and introduces several effective dynamic thermal management techniques such as temperature-tracking frequency scaling and migrating computation to regulate operating temperature.

Bus-invert coding for low-power I/O; This paper proposes the bus-invert method of coding I/O, which lowers bus activity to decrease peak power dissipation by 50% and average power dissipation by up to 25% for CMOS circuits.

HotSpot: A compact thermal modeling methodology for early-stage VLSI design; This paper presents HotSpot, a computationally efficient compact thermal modeling methodology for early-stage VLSI design that provides detailed static and transient temperature information across the die and package, including an on-chip interconnect self-heating model.

Temperature-aware microarchitecture: Modeling and implementation; This paper describes HotSpot, an accurate and fast thermal model for microarchitectural studies, and introduces several effective dynamic thermal management methods, including temperature-tracking frequency scaling and migrating computation to spare hardware units.

Control-theoretic techniques and thermal-RC modeling for accurate and localized dynamic thermal management; This paper proposes using formal feedback control theory, specifically a PID controller, for adaptive dynamic thermal management in processors and develops an efficient thermal-RC model to accurately test the proposed fetch "toggling" mechanism.

Unlocking High-Performance Low-Power Adiabatic Logic Computing with Modern FinFET Technology Node; This paper explores the potential of adiabatic logic circuits in modern FinFET technologies, demonstrating through simulation that they can achieve significant power savings at higher clock rates than previously possible, making them a viable solution for ultra-low power ICs.

Virtualized Computational RFID (VCRFID) Solution for Industry 4.0 Applications; This paper presents a Virtualized Computational RFID solution for Industry 4.0 applications that keeps tags minimalistic by offloading computational tasks to the reader, enabling a 97% reduction in energy consumption for battery-less, fine-grain monitoring.

Cool-3D: An End-to-End Thermal-Aware Framework for Early-Phase Design Space Exploration of Microfluidic-Cooled 3DICs; This paper presents Cool-3D, an end-to-end, thermal-aware framework for early-phase design space exploration of microfluidic-cooled 3D integrated circuits that integrates architectural simulators with advanced cooling models to enable flexible and accurate modeling.

Design and Modeling for Very High-sensitivity UHF RF Energy Harvesting Circuit; This work proposes a highly sensitive UHF RF energy harvesting circuit in a 22-nm FDSOI technology by optimizing a combined RF-DC rectifier with a DC-DC converter, using techniques like flipped well transistors and dynamic leakage suppression to improve performance.

Modern electroplating; This book, "Modern Electroplating, Fifth Edition," serves as a comprehensive, one-stop reference to the latest methods and applications of electroplating metals, alloys, and semiconductors, with special emphasis on nanotechnologies, data storage, and medical applications.

Theory and practice of metal electrodeposition; This book provides new insights into the theoretical and applied aspects of metal electrodeposition, covering the electrochemistry of metals, the technology of deposition, and the properties and structure of coatings for advanced students and researchers.

Advanced alkaline water electrolysis; This paper reviews fundamental and technological issues in alkaline and PEM water electrolysis, arguing that advancements in non-PGM catalysts are poised to benefit alkaline electrolyzers, and presents data showing an advanced alkaline electrolyzer with performance rivaling PEM devices.

Corrosion resistance of ternary Ni P based alloys in sulfuric acid solutions; This study investigated the corrosion behavior of autocatalytically deposited Ni-P based alloy films in sulfuric acid, finding that while they do not passivate like pure Ni, their corrosion resistance improves with increasing P content and can be further enhanced by adding W.

Magnetic nanowires in hexagonally ordered pores of alumina; This paper describes the fabrication and magnetic properties of Fe and Co nanowires deposited in the hexagonally ordered nanopores of anodized alumina, achieving excellent hexagonal ordering and high out-of-plane coercivity.

Exploration of the Electrodeposition of Smooth Near-Equiatomic CoCuFeNi from Glycine-Citrate Electrolytes; This work explores the electrodeposition of smooth, near-equiatomic CoCuFeNi multi-principal element alloys from glycine-citrate electrolytes, investigating the influence of deposition parameters on film composition and morphology.

Electroplating, Electrodeposition Combined with Vapor Deposition PVD for Advanced Manufacturing; This presentation discusses industrial applications of combined electrodeposition and physical vapor deposition techniques for creating metal and alloy coatings on fashion accessories with high resistance to corrosion and wear.

Electrodeposition of Near-Equiatomic CoCuFeNi Multi-Principal Element Alloys from an Acidic Glycine-Citrate-Triton X100 Aqueous Electrolyte; This work successfully synthesized near-equiatomic CoCuFeNi multi-principal element alloy films via electrodeposition from an acidic glycine-citrate-Triton X-100 electrolyte, demonstrating control over composition and morphology to produce a single crystalline phase.

Determinants of resistance to engineered T cell therapies targeting CD19 in large B cell lymphomas; By profiling over 700 longitudinal specimens from large B cell lymphoma patients treated with CAR19 T cells, this study identifies multiple classes of gene alterations associated with resistance, including those in B cell identity, immune checkpoints, and the tumor microenvironment.

Applications of focused ultrasound-mediated blood-brain barrier opening; This review discusses the application of focused ultrasound in conjunction with microbubbles to transiently and non-invasively disrupt the blood-brain barrier, enabling localized delivery of therapeutics and demonstrating potential for neuromodulation and other physiological responses.

Barriers to immune cell infiltration in tumors; This review highlights the intracellular and extracellular barriers to T cell infiltration into tumors, such as deficient homing receptor ligands on tumor vasculature, and discusses multiple therapeutic approaches that show promise in enhancing immune-mediated cancer control.

Focused ultrasound immunotherapy for central nervous system pathologies: challenges and opportunities; This paper contends that MR image-guided focused ultrasound represents a noninvasive approach for favorable therapeutic immunomodulation in the central nervous system, particularly by overcoming the blood-brain barrier to enable effective drug delivery.

Perspectives on recent progress in focused ultrasound immunotherapy; This paper provides an updated perspective on the progress of focused ultrasound immunotherapy over the last two years, highlighting its potential as a non-invasive technique for eliciting immune mechanisms in cancer and other pathologies.

Evaluation of a PET Insert for Trimodal Imaging: A Step Towards PET/MRI-Guided Focused Ultrasound; This work presents the design and evaluation of a preclinical PET insert for simultaneous operation with MRI and FUS systems, a step towards creating a trimodal PET-MRI-FUS system for monitoring therapeutic effects during focused ultrasound applications.

Abstract A038: Overcoming myeloid-mediated immunosuppression and enhancing blood-brain barrier access to advance B7H3 CAR T cell therapy in high-risk Medulloblastoma; This study aims to improve the efficacy of B7-H3-directed CAR T-cell therapy for aggressive Group 3 medulloblastoma by using the TLR7/8 agonist Resiquimod to reprogram immunosuppressive macrophages and low-intensity focused ultrasound to enhance drug and CAR T-cell infiltration across the blood-brain barrier.

CAR-T cell therapy in brain malignancies: obstacles in the face of cellular trafficking and persistence; This review addresses the two predominant barriers to CAR-T cell therapy efficacy in brain malignancies—cellular trafficking and persistence—by discussing the underlying limiting mechanisms and evaluating current and novel strategies to overcome these challenges.

Therapeutic Ultrasound for Multimodal Cancer Treatment: A Spotlight on Breast Cancer; This review spotlights recent advancements in therapeutic focused ultrasound for breast cancer care, outlining its physical principles and multifaceted roles in tumor ablation, drug delivery, radiosensitization, and enhancement of tumor-specific immune responses.

Abstract C030: Timing of melanoma brain metastasis seeding dictates the immunomodulatory effect and efficacy of systemic anti-CD40 agonist therapy; This study investigated whether the timing of melanoma brain metastasis seeding in a two-site mouse model impacts the intracranial efficacy of systemic anti-CD40 agonist therapy, a treatment aimed at improving the anti-tumoral immune response.

Speckle reducing anisotropic diffusion; This paper derives and validates speckle reducing anisotropic diffusion (SRAD), a partial differential equation-based filtering method tailored to ultrasonic and radar imaging that acts as an edge-sensitive diffusion for speckled images.

Functional aspects of meningeal lymphatics in ageing and Alzheimer’s disease; This study shows that meningeal lymphatic vessels drain macromolecules from the central nervous system into cervical lymph nodes, and that impairment of this function in aged mice slows waste clearance and induces cognitive impairment, which can be reversed by treatment with vascular endothelial growth factor C.

Active contour external force using vector field convolution for image segmentation; This paper proposes a new external force for active contours called vector field convolution (VFC), which addresses problems like limited capture range and poor convergence to concavities by convolving the image edge map with a user-defined vector field kernel.

Image enhancement using a contrast measure in the compressed domain; This paper presents a computationally efficient image enhancement algorithm for JPEG-compressed images that operates in the decompression stage, based on a contrast measure defined within the discrete cosine transform domain.

Peripherally derived macrophages can engraft the brain independent of irradiation and maintain an identity distinct from microglia; This study demonstrates that chronic, partial microglia depletion is sufficient for peripherally derived macrophages to engraft the brain without irradiation, where they maintain a unique functional and transcriptional identity distinct from microglia without altering behavior.

A dynamic predictive transformer with temporal relevance regression for action detection; This paper introduces a dynamic predictive transformer network for skeleton-based action detection that incorporates future frame data during training and an adaptive temporal attention system to improve temporal analysis and boundary frame detection.

PSF-SRDN: Point Spread Function-Aware Speckle Reducing Diffusion Network; This paper proposes PSF-SRDN, a novel point spread function-aware speckle reducing diffusion network that encodes the spectrum of lateral and axial distortions to enable adaptive denoising of ultrasound images corrupted with signal-dependent speckle.

Why instructional activities within classroom activity structures matter and how teacher dashboards can support advancements in instruction; This article argues that while AI can now classify classroom activity structures, it is the instructional activities within those structures that matter for student learning, and teacher dashboards powered by AI could support advancements in instruction.

Dynamic Average Consensus for Improving Classifier Accuracy for Multi-Camera Video Sequences; This paper shows that the dynamic average consensus algorithm can be applied to improve object detection classifier accuracy in a multi-camera network by averaging the latent features extracted from each camera's detection network.

Student Engagement Assessment in Classrooms Using a Novel 3D Eye-Gaze Estimation and Evaluation Algorithm; This paper introduces a novel technique for evaluating student attentiveness in classrooms by analyzing their 3D eye gaze direction, derived from a new 3D head pose estimation algorithm that does not require frontal face information.

Structural and material changes in the aging thorax and their role in crash protection for older occupants; This study quantified structural changes in the aging bony thorax using CT scans and a finite element model, finding that ribs become more perpendicular to the spine with age, a change that significantly increases the risk of rib fracture in simulated frontal impacts.

Spherical indentation load-relaxation of soft biological tissues; This study used elastic-viscoelastic correspondence to derive solutions for spherical indentation load-relaxation tests on soft biological tissues, demonstrating the method's utility in obtaining material properties like shear modulus and time constants for rubber, kidney tissue, and costal cartilage.

Fatality risk and the presence of rib fractures; By analyzing the National Trauma Databank, this study found that the presence of rib fractures (AIS 3+) significantly increases fatality risk in motor vehicle crash patients, with the effect being more pronounced in younger adults (18-45) than in older adults (over 64).

Impact response of restrained PMHS in frontal sled tests: skeletal deformation patterns under seat belt loading; This study evaluated the skeletal deformation of restrained post-mortem human subjects in 40 km/h frontal sled tests, finding that anterior and superior displacement of the lower ribcage may have contributed to early sternal fractures at lower-than-expected displacement levels.

Spinal injury rates and specific causation in motor vehicle collisions; This paper describes methods for determining the specific causation of spinal injuries in motor vehicle collisions by analyzing injury rates from national databases and reviewing the biomechanical literature to distinguish acute injuries from chronic degenerative disease.
STAPP CAR CRASH; This document lists the editorial review board for Volume 64 of the Stapp Car Crash Journal, a leading publication in the field of impact biomechanics and automotive safety.

The development of mandatory practices for the testing and maintenance of synthetic turf fields in the National Football League; This paper describes the development of mandatory testing and maintenance practices for synthetic turf fields in the National Football League, based on a literature review and expert opinion, to improve the consistency and safety of playing surfaces.

Automated turf testing apparatus and system for using same; This patent describes a mobile, automated apparatus for measuring controlled and applied forces and moments on sport surfaces like artificial turf to assess the performance and safety of athletic apparel and surfaces.

The interplay of fibroblasts, the extracellular matrix, and inflammation in scar formation; This review navigates the four stages of wound healing to explore the interplay between fibroblasts, the extracellular matrix, and inflammation in scar formation, arguing that a systems-level understanding is necessary to replicate fetal scarless healing.

Lactate is a metabolic mediator that shapes immune cell fate and function; This article summarizes the known effects of lactate and associated H+ ions on immune cells, highlighting their generally immunosuppressive but context-specific roles in augmenting certain immune functions, with implications for cancer, sepsis, and autoimmunity.

Lactic acid suppresses IL-33–mediated mast cell inflammatory responses via hypoxia-inducible factor-1α–dependent miR-155 suppression; This study shows that lactic acid suppresses IL-33-mediated mast cell inflammatory responses in a pH-dependent manner by enhancing hypoxia-inducible factor-1α, which in turn suppresses miR-155, a key regulator of IL-33 signaling.

Lactic acid inhibits lipopolysaccharide-induced mast cell function by limiting glycolysis and ATP availability; This study demonstrates that lactic acid inhibits lipopolysaccharide-induced mast cell function by limiting glycolysis and ATP availability, a mechanism that is dependent on monocarboxylate transporter-1 and may contribute to the immunosuppressive phase of sepsis.

Crosstalk between T cells and fibroblasts in biomaterial-mediated fibrosis; This review explores the crosstalk between T cells and fibroblasts in the context of biomaterial-induced fibrosis, highlighting how different T cell subsets can modulate fibroblast activity and contribute to the foreign body response that leads to implant failure.

A Thy-1–negative immunofibroblast population emerges as a key determinant of fibrotic outcomes to biomaterials; This study identifies a distinct Thy-1-negative immunofibroblast population that emerges in response to inflammatory cytokines IL-1β and TNFα as a key determinant of fibrotic encapsulation around biomaterials.

IL-33 induces cellular and exosomal miR-146a expression as a feedback inhibitor of mast cell function; This study reveals that the inflammatory cytokine IL-33 induces the expression of miR-146a in mast cells, which then acts as a feedback inhibitor to negatively regulate IL-33-mediated mast cell function.

High-dimensional comparison of monocytes and T cells in post-COVID and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis; Using single-cell analysis, this study found that decreased circulating monocytes are associated with persistent pulmonary fibrosis and reduced lung function in post-COVID patients, an immune signature that resembles idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

Inferring causal molecular networks: empirical assessment through a community-based effort; This paper describes the HPN-DREAM community challenge, which demonstrated through the assessment of over 2,000 submitted networks that inferring causal molecular relationships from complex biological data is feasible, especially when incorporating prior biological knowledge.

Transformers learn to implement preconditioned gradient descent for in-context learning; This paper theoretically proves that linear transformers, when trained on random linear regression tasks, can learn to implement iterations of preconditioned gradient descent in their forward pass, with the preconditioning matrix adapting to both the input distribution and data variance.

Escaping saddles with stochastic gradients; This paper shows that the inherent variance of stochastic gradients in certain non-convex models has a strong component along negative curvature directions, enabling plain SGD to escape saddle points without explicit noise injection and achieving a dimension-independent convergence rate.

Exponential convergence rates for batch normalization: The power of length-direction decoupling in non-convex optimization; This paper provides a theoretical explanation for Batch Normalization's success, proving it accelerates optimization by decoupling the length and direction of parameters, which allows gradient-based methods to leverage a favorable global loss landscape and achieve exponential convergence rates in certain non-convex settings.

Estimating diffusion network structures: Recovery conditions, sample complexity & soft-thresholding algorithm; This paper provides a theoretical framework and an efficient soft-thresholding algorithm for inferring hidden network structures from diffusion cascades, establishing that the correct structure can be recovered with high probability given a sufficient number of observations.

Linear Transformers Implicitly Discover Unified Numerical Algorithms; This study shows that a linear transformer trained on matrix completion tasks implicitly discovers a single, unified, resource-adaptive iterative solver that spans prediction, estimation, and Nyström extrapolation without being explicitly programmed to do so.

Data Generation without Function Estimation; This paper proposes a novel, estimation-free generative method that uses deterministic gradient descent on a set of interacting particles to transport a uniform distribution to an arbitrary data distribution, avoiding the need for function estimation, neural networks, or noise injection.

Transformers can learn temporal difference methods for in-context reinforcement learning; This paper demonstrates both empirically and theoretically that a transformer, when trained on policy evaluation tasks, can discover and learn to implement temporal difference learning in its forward pass, providing a mechanism for in-context reinforcement learning.

Provable optimal transport with transformers: The essence of depth and prompt engineering; This paper proves that a transformer with fixed parameters can effectively solve the optimal transport problem by implementing an adaptive gradient descent algorithm on the dual problem, demonstrating that prompt engineering and network depth are essential for its algorithmic expressivity and performance.

You watch, you give, and you engage: a study of live streaming practices in China; Through a mixed-methods study of 527 users in China, this paper explores live streaming practices, revealing how content, reward systems, and fan groups engage users, and highlighting a desire for deeper interaction mechanisms.

Thor's hammer: An ungrounded force feedback device utilizing propeller-induced propulsive force; This paper introduces Thor's Hammer, a novel handheld haptic device that uses six propellers to generate up to 4 Newtons of ungrounded, 3-DOF force feedback, enhancing realism and immersion in virtual reality applications.

Pre-Touch Sensing for Mobile Interaction; This paper explores a pre-touch sensing modality on mobile devices that detects fingers hovering above the screen, enabling novel interactions such as anticipatory user interfaces and hybrid touch-hover gestures.

SplitBoard: A simple split soft keyboard for wristwatch-sized touch screens; This paper introduces SplitBoard, a simple split soft keyboard for smartwatches that allows users to flick between halves of a QWERTY layout, which outperformed other text entry methods in user studies for initial performance and learnability.

ThingMoji: User-Captured Cut-Outs For In-Stream Visual Communication; This paper introduces ThingMoji, a novel form of user-captured visual cut-outs that allows live stream viewers to create and share unique icons from the stream content, enhancing expressive communication between streamers and their audience.

SpaceShare: Leveraging Multimodal Context for Fluid Sharing of Spaces in Video Meetings; This paper presents SpaceShare, a video meeting system that integrates real-time 3D space reconstruction and leverages multimodal context to enable fluid spatial sharing, independent exploration, and conversational retrieval of spatial features.

CustomSight: Enhancing LLM-Powered Visual Assistance for Blind Individuals using Goal-Directed Dynamic Filters; This paper presents CustomSight, an LLM-powered assistive technology that helps blind and visually impaired users query their visual environment by using goal-directed dynamic filters to provide real-time camera framing guidance and automated image capture.

Thing2Reality: Enabling Spontaneous Creation of 3D Objects from 2D Content using Generative AI in XR Meetings; This paper proposes Thing2Reality, an Extended Reality meeting platform that uses generative AI to enable users to spontaneously create and share 3D objects from 2D content, facilitating collaborative discussions in immersive environments.

DialogLab: Authoring, Simulating, and Testing Dynamic Human-AI Group Conversations; This paper introduces DialogLab, a prototyping toolkit that provides a unified interface for authoring, simulating, and testing complex, dynamic multi-party conversations involving both humans and AI agents.

A parallel solution–adaptive method for three-dimensional turbulent non-premixed combusting flows; This paper proposes and applies a parallel adaptive mesh refinement algorithm using a fully coupled finite-volume formulation to efficiently predict steady, three-dimensional, turbulent, non-premixed, compressible combusting flows.

A parallel adaptive mesh refinement algorithm for predicting turbulent non-premixed combusting flows; This paper proposes a parallel adaptive mesh refinement algorithm that uses a fully coupled finite-volume formulation and a flexible block-based data structure to efficiently predict turbulent non-premixed combusting flows.

Properties of lean turbulent methane-air flames with significant hydrogen addition; Using two-dimensional simulations, this study examines lean turbulent methane-air flames with hydrogen addition, finding that hydrogen significantly modulates methane chemistry, leading to a strong positive correlation between local burning speed and flame curvature.

Parallel solution-adaptive method for two-dimensional non-premixed combusting flows; This paper presents a parallel adaptive mesh refinement algorithm using a fully coupled finite-volume formulation to predict two-dimensional laminar and turbulent non-premixed combusting flows, demonstrating its validity through comparisons with experimental data.

Numerical simulation of nitrogen oxide formation in lean premixed turbulent H2/O2/N2 flames; This study uses numerical simulations to show that localized hotspots created by thermodiffusive instabilities in lean premixed turbulent hydrogen flames lead to significant production of nitrogen oxides, even at temperatures well below 1800K.

Towards a Quantum Algorithm for the Incompressible Nonlinear Navier-Stokes Equations; This work proposes a new framework for a quantum algorithm to solve the incompressible nonlinear Navier-Stokes equations, using matrix product states and operators combined with Krylov subspace methods to represent and evolve the system efficiently on quantum computers.

On the Parallel Performance of a Novel Brick-Based Hash-Table CFD Library for Distributed Computing; This paper evaluates the parallel performance of HashBrick, a novel brick-based hash-table CFD library, demonstrating its performance portability and efficiency for distributed computing on heterogeneous CPU-GPU architectures through a weak-scaling study.

Overlapping domain decomposition methods for finite volume discretizations; This paper analyzes two-level additive overlapping domain decomposition methods for finite volume discretizations of elliptic problems, proving that the condition number of the preconditioned system does not depend on the number of subdomains.

Application of a fourth-order accurate finite-volume method with adaptive refinement in space and time to multifluid plasma simulations; This paper applies a novel fourth-order accurate finite-volume method with adaptive mesh refinement in space and time to a multifluid plasma model, demonstrating improved solution stability and a significant reduction in compute time for complex test cases involving shocks.

Angular momentum of walking at different speeds; This study found that during human walking at different speeds, the angular momentum of the body about its center of mass is small and highly regulated, with the arms and trunk making the largest contributions.

Angular momentum synergies during walking; This study used the uncontrolled manifold hypothesis to demonstrate that synergies among segmental angular momenta exist during the swing phase of walking to stabilize the whole-body angular momentum.

Improvements in lower-extremity function following a rehabilitation program with patterned electrical neuromuscular stimulation in females with patellofemoral pain: A …; This double-blinded randomized controlled trial evaluated the effects of a 4-week rehabilitation program combined with patterned electrical neuromuscular stimulation on lower-extremity biomechanics and muscle activity in females with patellofemoral pain.

The effects of ankle foot orthoses on energy recovery and work during gait in children with cerebral palsy; This study found that wearing ankle foot orthoses increased stride length and energy recovery during walking in children with cerebral palsy, without changing the total mechanical work performed.

Landing stiffness between individuals with and without a history of low back pain; This cross-sectional study compared lower-extremity and lumbar spine stiffness during a landing task between individuals with and without a history of low back pain to identify potential biomechanical adaptations.

An Augmented Full-Body Model that Improves Upper Body Tracking and Reduces Dynamic Inconsistency in Complex Motion: X. Hu et al.; This study developed and validated an augmented full-body musculoskeletal model that adds joints to the spine and shoulders, significantly improving the accuracy of upper body kinematic tracking and reducing dynamic inconsistency during complex sports motions.

Coin Test: A Complementary Examination for Assessing Upper Extremity Function in Cervical Myelopathy; This prospective study demonstrates that a new "Coin Test" is a highly specific and sensitive tool for assessing upper extremity function and diagnosing cervical spondylotic myelopathy, showing significant improvement in patient performance after surgery.

Torque complexity of maximal knee extensor isometric contraction in individuals following anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction; This study compared the complexity of quadriceps torque fluctuations during maximal isometric contraction between individuals with anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction, their contralateral limb, and healthy controls to assess its relationship with patient outcomes.

Improvement of postural stability and gait velocity after cervical decompression surgery in patients with cervical spondylotic myelopathy; This study found that patients with cervical spondylotic myelopathy showed significant improvements in gait velocity, step length, and postural stability at 3 and 6 months following cervical decompression surgery.

Comprehensive dynamic and kinematic analysis of the rodent hindlimb during over ground walking; This study provides a comprehensive biomechanical analysis of the rat hindlimb during walking, characterizing spatiotemporal parameters, ground reaction forces, 3D joint kinematics, kinetics, and energetics to establish a baseline for preclinical models of extremity injury.

Corrosion of additively manufactured alloys: a review; This paper reviews the corrosion of additively manufactured alloys, correlating their performance to unique microstructural features like porosity, grain structure, and residual stress that result from the manufacturing process.

In situ confocal laser scanning microscopy of AA 2024-T3 corrosion metrology: I. Localized corrosion of particles; This study used in situ confocal laser scanning microscopy to investigate the localized corrosion of intermetallic particles on AA 2024-T3, finding that the type and rate of attack are controlled by galvanic coupling between the particles and the alloy matrix.

Passivity breakdown and pitting corrosion of binary alloys; This paper explains the passivity breakdown and pitting corrosion of binary alloys using a percolation model where a passive oxide layer forms only when the concentration of the more noble element exceeds a critical threshold.

In situ confocal laser scanning microscopy of AA 2024-T3 corrosion metrology II. Trench formation around particles; This study uses in situ confocal laser scanning microscopy to investigate trench formation around cathodic particles on AA 2024-T3, concluding that an anodic trench model best explains the observed corrosion behavior.

Repassivation of stainless steels: A unifying quantitative framework; This study presents a unifying quantitative framework that connects the repassivation potential of stainless steels to key electrochemical and chemical parameters, demonstrating that molybdenum in SS316L enhances repassivation by suppressing anodic and accelerating cathodic kinetics.
